title: Sustainability Senior Manager (Hospitality MNC)
company_info: RecruitPedia is an innovative, efficacious recruitment solution provider headquartered in Singapore. We are constantly expanding and our trained headhunting consultants are distinguished by their extensive international industry knowledge and experience. It will be our greatest honour to be able to guide you along the ever-changing job market and assist you step-by-step with any challenges you face along the way. RecruitPedia believes that all our clients and candidates deserve excellent service and strives to be the best and trusted service provider.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our Client is a SGX Listed company in Hospitality industry. Due to business needs, they are now recruiting a Senior Sustainability Manager to be part of their Sustainability team for ongoing transformation projects. They are located in the West Area - easily accessible.

Roles and Responsibilities of Senior Sustainability Manager:
Facilitate effective coordination among the Company's Board of Directors, Finance, Operations, Communications, and relevant department heads for sustainability initiatives.
Guide and ensure compliance with regulatory frameworks such as TCFD, GRI, UNGC, SASB, and other applicable standards for formal sustainability reporting.
Ensure timely adherence to all requirements outlined in the Company's Memorandum of Association and Articles of Association.
Administer and approve project funds through the appropriate governance body and ensure transparent and effective financial management.
Take responsibility for the financial sustainability of the Company by overseeing annual expenditures and revenue generation.
Collaborate with sustainability-related departments to ensure consistent implementation of core sustainability programs.
Work with department leaders to troubleshoot and guide them in meeting annual and long-term sustainability targets, such as waste reduction, water conservation, biodiversity preservation, climate action, and diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) initiatives.
Prepare and present regular financial and sustainability reports to the Company's leadership.
Coordinate and plan key sustainability-related events and communication strategies.
Represent the Company in relevant networks and establish strategic partnerships to promote and achieve sustainability goals.
Requirements:
Degree in any discipline
Min 5 years of relevant experience
Experience in tourism & hospitality industry is a bonus
Interested candidates who wish to apply for the advertised position, please click APPLY NOW or email an updated copy of your resume/cv.
We regret that only shortlisted candidate will be notified.
Email Address: Jobs@recruitpedia.sg
EA License No: 19C9682

EA Personnel Name: Oh Puey Xin

title: Porter (Farrer Park Hospital)
company_info: Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, ISS is a leading global provider of facility services, offering services on an international scale with leveraged knowledge and experience. The secret to our success lies in how we tailor our solutions to client needs, how we manage risk, and how our engaged team of more than 490,000 staff members add the power of the human touch in everything we do. At ISS we deliver a wide range of self-performed services that can be combined in numerous ways according to the customer’s requirements. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Perform portering services for patients to and from the wards/ specialist clinics/ departments/ external centres in a safe and professional manner.
Deliver and collect medical/patient records, specimens, medications or any other items within a hospital environment.
Comply with quality service, safety and health requirements of ISS and customers.
Build strong relationships with stakeholders and anticipate their needs.
Implement productivity related initiatives.
REQUIREMENTS
Able to communicate with English speaking user/ customer.
Basic IT knowledge is required to handle e-system, computer, smartphones.
Able to handle difficult customer.
KEY BEHAVIORS
Build effective team.
Customer focused.
Drive results.
Ensure accountability.
WORKING HOURS / DAYS
7am to 3pm, 9am to 5pm, 11am to 7pm, and 1pm to 9pm | 6 days work week

Retention Bonus *Terms & Conditions apply
Training Provided

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Working Location: KKH HOSPITAL

Job Summary:
To be responsible for the overall patient meal service and maintain good relationship with the patient

· To be responsible for the meal service for the patients including meal order taking, meal service and tray clearance
· To liaise with various departments such as dietetics and kitchen to ensure accurate patient meal service
· To follow the procedures related to control room pertaining to meal service
· To provide excellent customer service to the patients in the wards.
· To ensure a good relation with the patients and make sure their concerns are taken care of.

title: Nurse Clinician (Hospital)
company_info: Aber care is a Healthcare Recruitment Agency providing Permanent, Part-time and Locum placements for Nursing Homes, Day Care Centers, Community Hospitals and Restructured Hospitals. job_category: Environment / Health, Healthcare / Pharmaceutical, Medical / Therapy Services
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
You will be an integral part of the team in Hospital to provide nursing care to acute patients.
Assesses, plans, implements and evaluates care of resident with complex healthcare needs according to updated standards of nursing practice.
Conducts teaching and counselling for patients.
Initiates and ensures implementation of discharge planning for residents with potential for discharge.
Ensures patient care delivery is carried out according to established standards of care and practice.
Ensures written policies and SOP is available and up to date to guide nursing practices.
Provides direct care to residents to ensure compliance to standards
Ensures smooth transition of residents from acute to chronic care and back to community where possible.
Conducts nursing audits on nursing care standards and initiates strategies to resolve non-adherence issues.
Directs and facilitates staff development, skills and competency upgrading through in-house training, approved online learning or formal education opportunities.
Guides orientation/induction programmes and preceptorship for new staff.
Supports the SNM in nursing home management and deputizes her in her absence.
Acts as a resource person to the nurse manager in clinical nursing and nursing.
Job Requirements:
Advanced Diploma/ Degree in Nursing
Registered with the Singapore Nursing Board
Minimum 5 years of relevant experience as managerial role
Check out Aber Care Website for detail

title: Butler (Farrer Park Hospital)
company_info: Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, ISS is a leading global provider of facility services, offering services on an international scale with leveraged knowledge and experience. The secret to our success lies in how we tailor our solutions to client needs, how we manage risk, and how our engaged team of more than 490,000 staff members add the power of the human touch in everything we do. At ISS we deliver a wide range of self-performed services that can be combined in numerous ways according to the customer’s requirements. Creating a flexible, transparent and tailor-made FM solution in close dialogue with the customer is critical for scaling services to meet the changing needs of the organisation.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
A good understanding of all the various diets available and its suitability for each patient E.g therapeutic Diets, Soft Diets, Halal , Non Halal.
Checking diet chit for accuracy before serving to patient.
Daily changing of water jugs and cups for patients.
Ensure diet chit and patient details are tally.
Take meal order for every patient at 4.00pm daily in the EMOS (Electronic Meal Ordering System) and practice service quality standards.
Serve breakfast, lunch, tea break and dinner on time
Clear food trays within the stipulated time.
Clean patient refrigerator weekly and ensure all food store in the refrigerators are labelled.
Check and record all refrigerators’ daily temperatures. Alert supervisors if the temperatures are not within the ideal range.
Daily upkeep patient pantry to ensure they are clean, tidy and organized.
Liaise with kitchen to ensure adequate supply of condiments supplies in the pantry eg Stirrer, Sugar, Creamer, Milo, Butter, Jam
Check and discard all expired food e.g Bread,
Wipe and clean patients’ tables before and after meal
Upkeep ward food trolleys by making sure they are clean and tidy at all times.
Comply to all service quality, infection control, health and safety requirements by customer or ISS
Follow every instruction on infection control and wear the appropriate personal protective safety (PPE) at all times.
Undertake duties or improvement projects assigned by superior.
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Candidates should have at least a Secondary Education in any discipline with or without working experiences.
Must have an eye for details.
Service Oriented – caring, friendly, helpful and positive
Preferably with some experience in Hotel, Food & Beverage , Hospitality or Retail Industry
Experience in working in a dynamic and challenging environment.
Basic IT Knowledge
Well groomed
Able to communicate with English speaking user/ customer.
Team player

Working location: Farrer Park Hospital

Roles & Responsibilities
You will be part of a multidisciplinary team intervening in acute or chronic diseases to maintain current health, and/or promote the wellness of patients.
On a daily basis, you will identify, resolve, and prevent drug-related problems, recommend and monitor patient-specific drug therapy, assure safe and effective alternatives as appropriate, document the outcomes and oversee drug distribution. This includes active participation in regular inpatient clinical rounds and/or ambulatory care clinics, as well as dispensing medications and counselling patients on their medication treatment. You will also communicate timely and accurate drug information, and provide education to the general public, patients, and fellow healthcare workers on matters pertaining to safe and effective medication use.

Eligible for registration with the Singapore Pharmacy Council
Work experience in direct patient care is an advantage
Possess good initiative, drive and ability to work effectively in a team in a fast-paced environment

title: General Manager, Hospitality
company_info: A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London. NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N). Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district. Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources. For more information, visit www.ntu.edu.sg
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Hospitality Unit is part of the NTU Hospitality and Events Office, dedicated to overseeing, enhancing, and optimising the utilisation and operations of NTU's hospitality assets, ensuring that they meet global standards, offer exceptional experiences, and reflect NTU's mission and values. In line with the University’s aspirations
The overarching vision of the Hospitality Unit is to make NTU not just an academic hub but also a premier destination for events, dining, and accommodations, thereby integrating academia, students, staff and visitors with unparalleled hospitality experiences.
Leading the NTU Hospitality Unit, the General Manager (GM) oversees and enhances the university's hospitality and MICE assets, aiming to integrate unparalleled hospitality and MICE experiences with academia. This role requires a Bachelor's/Master's in Hospitality, 10+ years in senior management within hospitality, profound knowledge of industry trends, and exceptional leadership skills. The GM will collaborate across NTU, ensuring the synergy of hospitality services with academic and community engagements.

Responsibilities
Strategic Oversight and Leadership: Oversight and strategic direction of the University's hospitality assets, ensuring they not only align with but enhance the University's reputation, offerings, and broader objectives, such as in the long-term development of hospitality assets.
Asset Management, Enhancement and Optimisation: Oversee the maintenance, upgrade, and efficient utilisation of hospitality assets, including accommodation, event spaces, and F&B outlets. Develop and drive strategies to ensure consistent quality and profitability.
Infrastructure Management and Development: Lead in and oversee the planning, design, construction, and refurbishment of Nanyang Executive Centre (NEC), Campus Clubhouse, Halal Dining Hall and other assets.
Stakeholder Engagement: Develop and leverage on strategic alliances to enhance NTU's hospitality offerings
Quality Assurance & Compliance: Define, implement and maintain quality assurance protocols. Ensure all operations adhere to university policies and external regulations
Financial Management and Independence: Develop and lead the strategic financial plan for the hospitality unit, ensuring that the unit becomes and remains self-financing.
Guest Experience & Satisfaction: Review operating strategy and formulate and implement world-class service protocols.
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Hospitality Management, Business Administration, or related field. A Master’s degree in a related field would be advantageous.
Comprehensive understanding of the hospitality industry, including hotel management, F&B operations, event management, and customer service best practices.
Proficient knowledge in construction/project management.
Familiarity with architectural design principles and real estate development.
Awareness of the latest trends and innovations in the hospitality world.
Understanding of the unique challenges and opportunities of integrating hospitality within an academic setting.
Minimum of 12 to 15 years in the hospitality industry with at least 6 years in a leadership or managerial role, preferably within a university or large-scale event environment and overseeing a major refurbishment project.
Proven track record of managing hospitality assets, enhancing customer experiences, and driving profitability.
Extensive experience in fostering and sustaining collaborations with diverse internal and external stakeholders is critical.
Hiring Institution: NTU

title: Patient Service Associate(5061) - Alexandra Hospital
company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. Our versatile and experienced team of healthcare professionals has only one aim - to help people get better, and live healthier and longer lives. We do this by improving medical care, lowering disease recurrence, producing better healthcare professionals, and turning research findings into better medical treatments for diseases that affect Singaporeans. And the reason we’re able to do these things is because we have the best and most dedicated people. Come join us and help shape medicine for our future.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As a Patient Service Associate, you will deliver friendly and efficient customer service and create a warm and welcoming atmosphere for all internal and external customers / patients, with the key aim of providing excellent patient care and satisfaction.
Duties & Responsibilities
• Ensure clinic’s operational and procedural area readiness based on desired service standards.
• Assist with smooth patient journey including accurate and timely registration, discharge, appointment bookings, cashiering and any other enquiries such as insurance provider’s information for billing.
• Provide chaperone assistance to doctors/nurses and prepare consultation documents
• Attend to any requests, emails and phone enquiries.
• Assist clinic manager in administrative duties
• Perform any other ad-hoc duties and responsibilities that may be assigned from time to time
Requirements
• Candidate must possess at least “O” Levels/Diploma
• Proficient in computer skills, handling multiple systems such as SAP will be an advantage.
• Team player with good communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to speak a second language will be an advantage.
• Able to multitask and work in a fast-paced environment
• Candidates should be comfortable/flexible with working in a hospital setting and in different clinics when needed. Prior experience in hospitality or service industries will be an advantage.
• Be comfortable with working in inpatient wards if required.
If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Please indicate the position that you are interested in the subject heading.

title: Speech Therapist*(5149) - Alexandra Hospital
company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. Our versatile and experienced team of healthcare professionals has only one aim - to help people get better, and live healthier and longer lives. We do this by improving medical care, lowering disease recurrence, producing better healthcare professionals, and turning research findings into better medical treatments for diseases that affect Singaporeans. And the reason we’re able to do these things is because we have the best and most dedicated people. Come join us and help shape medicine for our future.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview
The Speech Therapist is responsible for the assessment and management of patients referred to speech therapy. Under supervision, s/he will assist in areas such as clinical supervision, research, professional education and induction.
Primary Responsibilities
• Assess and manage patients referred to speech therapy independently and implement appropriate treatment plans.
• Report to referring doctor and other members of the medical team.
• Document patient speech therapy records accurately.
• Charge patients accurately.
• Update individual performance statistical records regularly.
• Comply with clinical and service standards.
• Supervise TA in the workgroup.
• Practice within areas of professional competence and seek clinical support from supervisor / other healthcare professionals when appropriate.
Secondary Responsibilities
• Collaborate with other healthcare members and participate in case conferences.
• Participate in clinical research.
• Carry out regular inventory / equipment checks.
• Assist in the review and update of clinical protocols and SOPs
• Assist in managing projects assigned to the workgroup.
• Participate in departmental QC and other activities, and to lead in some activities
• Assist in promoting / marketing clinical services.
• Assist in clinical education of speech therapy students.
• Assist in the induction of new speech therapists.
• Contribute to departmental inservice training programmes and hospital educational talks.
• Actively update speech therapy knowledge and skills.
Requirements
• Recognised Degree in Speech therapy that is recognized in Singapore.
• Registered with the Allied Health Professions Council.
• Good communication and interpersonal skills.
• Service oriented and customer focused.
• Result oriented.
• Team worker.
• Competent in IT skills (Microsoft Excel / Word / Access / Powerpoint).
• Basic supervisory skills preferred.
If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Please indicate the position that you are interested in the subject heading.

title: Junior Medical Technologist(5144) - Alexandra Hospital
company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. Our versatile and experienced team of healthcare professionals has only one aim - to help people get better, and live healthier and longer lives. We do this by improving medical care, lowering disease recurrence, producing better healthcare professionals, and turning research findings into better medical treatments for diseases that affect Singaporeans. And the reason we’re able to do these things is because we have the best and most dedicated people. Come join us and help shape medicine for our future.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
1. Job Purpose
A Junior Medical Technologist in Lung Function/Sleep & Gastromotility Lab is responsible for delivery of patients service in the work area in a personalised, specialised and cost-effective way in accordance to established hospital policies, procedures and standard of practices.
A Junior Medical Technologist in Lung Function/ Sleep Lab also provides laboratory support for all clinical cases that require lung function tests and sleep monitoring studies.
2. Duties and Responsibilities
Primary Duties and Responsibilities (80%)
To cooperate with doctors and other healthcare providers to ensure smooth delivery of services to patients.
To check and calibrate equipment/ emergency trolley and instruments to ensure that they are in good working condition.
To perform Lung Function Tests, Sleep Monitoring Studies and Gastromotility tests as requested by doctors according to hospital standards of operation.
To provide appropriate instructions to patient for follow-up review at specialist clinic.
To provide patient / family members on information regarding services to be rendered.
To edit and report the data generated from the studies for doctor to verify.
To ensure reports are ready for despatch to clinics/wards within stipulated time frame.
To be responsible for proper filing of patients’ reports for easy retrieval
To demonstrate proper and economical usage of consumables and supplies.
To ensure that stock level on supplies and consumables are adequately maintained and replenished.
To maintain and demonstrate proper use and care of equipment.
To maintain a clean and safe work environment.
To attend to patients’ feedback /enquiry, perform service recovery and provide information when appropriate.
Secondary Responsibilities and Duties (20%)
To attend to telephone enquiries / calls and trace results when requested.
To participate in service quality activities / programme.
To assume additional responsibilities as assigned by Supervisor(s).
Job Specification/Requirements
Qualification:
Diploma in Medical Science / Bio -Technology
Experience:
Preferably 1-2 years of related work experience in clinical setting.
Skills:
Competent in Microsoft softwares (Excel, Word, Powerpoint)
Possess good interpersonal and communication skills.
Able to step-up and provide coverage for lab partner during shortage of manpower.
Able to demonstrate efforts to problem-solve business-as-usual (BAU) issues
If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Please indicate the position that you are interested in the subject heading.

title: Senior / Engineer (3940) - Alexandra Hospital
company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. Our versatile and experienced team of healthcare professionals has only one aim - to help people get better, and live healthier and longer lives. We do this by improving medical care, lowering disease recurrence, producing better healthcare professionals, and turning research findings into better medical treatments for diseases that affect Singaporeans. And the reason we’re able to do these things is because we have the best and most dedicated people. Come join us and help shape medicine for our future.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
This position has a strong focus on Campus Redevelopment, for which planning has started and the new buildings will be completed in about 6 years’ time. You shall provide support to Office of Campus Planning by working closely with the design team, medical planner and users’ in preparing technical specifications for tender, evaluate tender submissions and providing recommendations based on technical compliance of medical equipment, furniture and fitment for the new Campus.
You may also be required to attach to the Group / Site team to familiar with Group BME policies and procedures through supporting on the daily operations to align with organization and regulatory requirements.
You will be responsible for the following:
Manage and support planning and procurement of medical, non-medical equipment, and furniture (where required)
• Plan and lead user workgroups by organising regular meeting sessions, setting goals and targets, facilitating useful and productive discussions, guiding user departments, as well as reviewing performance indicators and work plans
• Responsible for budgetary planning and control, ensuring that the development keeps within budget
• Work closely with user department and various stakeholders in the preparation of medical, non-medical equipment and furniture specifications for tenders
• Provide recommendation to users based on technical compliance of medical, non-medical equipment and furniture in tender submissions
• Support tender committees in their evaluation of equipment and services for procurement
• Write papers for approval on relevant subjects when required
• Keep abreast of healthcare planning topics and issues, so as to lead the hospital development in the desired direction
• Support the rest of the campus planning team where required
Support Group biomedical engineering equipment functions
• Attach to Group / Site team to familiarise with Group BME policies and procedures through supporting the daily operations to align with organisation and regulatory requirements
• Liaise and manage external contractors on service and tender commitment issues
• Provide technical advisory to end users and senior management on medical, non-medical equipment and furniture related issues
Perform any other duties as assigned
Qualification Required and Area of Discipline
At least a Diploma in Electronics or relevant Engineering course with at least 5 years of experience in service and maintenance of medical equipment
At least a Degree in Electronics or in relevant Engineering course with at least 3 years of experience in service and maintenance of medical equipment
Required Competencies and Capabilities (Skills, Experiences and Professional Licences)
Experience working in similar capacity in healthcare institutions
Good organisational and project management skills
Strong communication (both written and oral) and presentation skills
Problem solving, presentation, negotiation and interpersonal skills, and ability to work with various stakeholders
Team-player, with natural ability to interact with all levels of staff
Meticulous, organised, logical and analytical, able to fit different pieces of the puzzle together
Independent worker, with strong initiative for planning and doing, and able to work on several things at once
Advantageous to have basic understanding in Cybersecurity and IT network knowledge
Able to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment to meet deadlines
Adaptable and able to respond to changing and ambiguous situations
If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Please indicate the position that you are interested in the subject heading

title: Manager, Office of Campus Planning(5197) - Alexandra Hospital
company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. Our versatile and experienced team of healthcare professionals has only one aim - to help people get better, and live healthier and longer lives. We do this by improving medical care, lowering disease recurrence, producing better healthcare professionals, and turning research findings into better medical treatments for diseases that affect Singaporeans. And the reason we’re able to do these things is because we have the best and most dedicated people. Come join us and help shape medicine for our future.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview
This position has a strong focus on Campus Planning and Redevelopment, for which planning has already started. The new Campus offers a unique opportunity to design and test new care models for the future, and to care better for patients. It will be designed to be a great place for the community, well-integrated and seamlessly connected, and be built for sustainability to benefit future generations. The new Campus will be a transformational healing environment, where design is not just for a beautiful space, but also for an engaging culture for generations to come.
Job Responsibilities
Planning and Development
Be involved in hospital infrastructure and facilities planning, development and management.
Plan and lead user workgroups by organising regular meeting sessions, setting goals and targets, facilitating useful and productive discussions, guiding user departments, as well as reviewing performance indicators and work plans.
Be the bridge between user departments and consultants, so that detailed information, including hospital operations workflows, interdependencies, additional requests and ideas, are documented, transferred and communicated between and with all parties in a timely manner, and captured for holistic design, development and subsequent procurement planning.
Follow through on the project, including obtaining the sign offs and approvals where necessary before the space is built, all the time ensuring that the space is built according to approved plans.
Keep abreast of healthcare planning topics and issues, so as to lead the hospital development in the desired direction.
Operational Responsibilities
Support the user departments in design operations, procurement and scheduling.
Interface with the consultants and build stakeholder relationships, both internal and external, including government agencies and community partners.
Responsible for budgetary planning and control, ensuring that the development keeps within budget.
Be on the ground to manage various sub-projects, interacting with different stakeholders.
Write papers for approval on relevant subjects when required.
Support the rest of the campus planning team where required.
Other Project and Programme Management and Implementation of Strategy and Initiatives
Manage and coordinate several on-going projects and events at a time, keeping an eye on each timeline and achieving milestone goals to meet specific deadlines.
Assist in identifying strategy goals, initiatives and programmes, and developing action plans for and coordinating implementation.
Review the initiative and programme execution at regular intervals and report the progress at management meetings.
Other duties as assigned.
Requirements
Degree in any discipline
(Degree in Architecture / Interior Designing / Engineering is highly preferred)
At least 5 years of relevant work experience, preferably with project management experience
Candidates with healthcare background highly preferred
Demonstrated leadership qualities and strategic planning capabilities
Strong organizational and project management skills
Pleasant disposition, approachable and good interpersonal skills
Good listening ability, and a positive attitude
Stakeholder management and relationship building skills
Strong team-player, with natural ability to interact with all levels of staff
Excellent verbal, written communication and presentation skills
Meticulous, organised, logical and analytical, able to fit different pieces of the puzzle together
Independent worker, with strong initiative for planning and doing, and able to work on several things at once
Have a natural affinity for technology, and its enabling capabilities
Comfortable with ambiguity, unchartered territory, enjoy challenges and problem solving
If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Please indicate the position that you are interested in the subject heading.

title: Senior / Medical Social Worker(5088) - Alexandra Hospital
company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. Our versatile and experienced team of healthcare professionals has only one aim - to help people get better, and live healthier and longer lives. We do this by improving medical care, lowering disease recurrence, producing better healthcare professionals, and turning research findings into better medical treatments for diseases that affect Singaporeans. And the reason we’re able to do these things is because we have the best and most dedicated people. Come join us and help shape medicine for our future.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Challenges
Your core duty involves direct practice and will include casework, care planning, counselling, financial assistance to patients and family members. You will work closely with multidisciplinary professionals, participate in ward rounds and organize and facilitate family conferences to pursue holistic care for patients. You will participate in practice research and development of clinical social work.
You will provide person-centred care with an understanding of the person in their own environment and working closely with formal and informal support networks to allow patients to be empowered in decisions they make or to work towards their wishes and wants.
You would also be expected to participate in community engagements to proactively deliver care to the patients and their families.
You may also be assigned crisis intervention duties which would require priority responses and intensive case management to patients going through personal crisis, including attempted suicide or are victims of abuse.
Senior positions will require you to supervise colleagues, be a team leader, take on administrative roles and lead projects within the institution and the social work fraternity.
Medical disciplines you will work with : General Medicine, Renal Medicine, Rehab Medicine, Geriatric Medicine, Palliative Medicine and Psychological Medicine.
Services:
To provide counselling for patient and family in their understanding of the diagnosis & its implication on ADL functioning, preparing them for the implications on his overall care, coping with illness and recovery and financial needs.
To address patient’s and family’s acceptance of the diagnosis, change in roles, potential stresses and possible coping strategies with patient and family members, and to provide emotional support and motivate patient and family. Moving forward, to assist patient and family to set realistic and achievable goals.
To identify and make referral to appropriate services based on the multidisciplinary team’s assessment and patient’s social circumstances and social goals.
To explore and harness patient’s resources for the long term care plans. To facilitate family to make informed decisions, and ensure caregiver is competent and confident in the care before discharge home.
To make referrals for long term step-down facilities where necessary and eligible, and to arrange for interim care.
To participate in multidisciplinary ward rounds and case conferences to actively represent patients’ social, psychological and economic circumstances; to influence the team to act in the best interests of patients and families.
To provide support through end of life issues that patients and families may be facing and work through their grief and bereavement journeys.
Job Requirements:
Degree in Social Work; Post Graduate Diploma in Social Work; Master in Social Work
Post-graduate qualification in Counselling or Family Therapy will be an added advantage
Competent in IT skills and minimally bilingual
All qualifying staff will need to be Registered Social Workers with Singapore Association of Social Work
Committed and enjoy working as a team in a fast-paced, innovative and changing environment.
If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Please indicate the position that you are interested in the subject heading.

company_info: Resorts World Sentosa (RWS), Asia’s premium lifestyle destination resort, is located on Singapore’s resort island of Sentosa. Spanning 49 hectares, RWS is home to world-class attractions including Universal Studios Singapore, S.E.A. Aquarium, the Maritime Experiential Museum, Dolphin Island and Adventure Cove Waterpark. Complementing the adventure and adrenaline of its theme parks and attractions are six unique luxury hotels, the world-class Resorts World Convention Centre, a casino and the Asian flagship of a world-renowned destination spa. RWS offers award-winning dining experiences and exciting cuisines from around the world across its many renowned celebrity chef restaurants, establishing itself as a key player in Singapore’s vibrant and diverse dining scene and a leading gourmet destination in Asia for epicureans. The integrated resort also offers world-class entertainment, from original resident productions to concerts and public shows such as Crane Dance and Lake of Dreams. RWS has been named “Best Integrated Resort” since 2011 for nine consecutive years at the TTG Travel Awards which recognises the best of Asia-Pacific’s travel industry. RWS is wholly owned by Genting Singapore, a company of the Genting Group. For more information, please visit www.rwsentosa.com.

company_info: Annexion strives to be a premier Built Environment global headhunting consultancy and plays a key role in connecting all stakeholders in the Built Environment sector. job_category: Architecture / Interior Design, Consulting, Design, Hospitality, Others
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Position Overview: As the Design Leader, you will be a creative visionary and a strategic thinker, responsible for leading and shaping our design direction on a prestigious luxury hospitality project. You will lead and mentor a team of talented designers, ensuring that the project's design concept is executed flawlessly, meeting and exceeding the expectations of our discerning clients.

Key Responsibilities:
Design Vision: Develop and communicate a compelling design vision for the project, aligning with the client's goals and creating a unique luxury hospitality experience.
Design Leadership: Lead, inspire, and mentor a team of designers, fostering a collaborative and innovative design environment.
Concept Development: Drive the development of design concepts, ensuring they reflect the project's luxury and innovation aspirations.
Design Excellence: Oversee the design process, ensuring that design solutions meet the highest standards of quality, functionality, and aesthetics.
Client Collaboration: Build strong client relationships, effectively communicating design concepts and progress, and addressing client feedback and requirements.
Team Collaboration: Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including architects, project managers, and engineers, to ensure seamless integration of design and construction.
Budget Adherence: Work collaboratively with project managers to ensure that design efforts align with project budgets and timelines.
Material and Finish Selection: Lead the selection of materials, finishes, and furnishings that align with the project's luxury design concept.
Sustainability: Integrate sustainable design principles into the project, seeking innovative ways to minimize the environmental footprint.
Design Trends: Stay updated with the latest design trends, technologies, and materials in the luxury hospitality industry and infuse them into your design concepts.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Interior Design, Architecture, or a related field.
Minimum of 10 years of experience in luxury hospitality design, including leadership roles.
A strong portfolio showcasing your design leadership and creative vision.
Proven ability to lead and inspire design teams, driving innovation and excellence.
Exceptional understanding of luxury design principles and trends.
Proficiency in design software and tools (e.g., AutoCAD, SketchUp, Adobe Creative Suite).
Excellent communication, presentation, and client-facing skills.
Strong project management and organizational skills.

title: Group Internal Auditor (Hospitality / Property)
company_info: Founded by a team of experienced and passionate leaders in talent placement with specific knowledge in finance & accounting and human capital arena, Talenomics Pte Ltd (EA Licence No.: 19C9823) is a boutique executive search firm with strong market access to talents and career opportunities in Singapore. The purpose of our role is to drive “Talent Economics” in the talent acquisition process. We identify the right opportunity for the talent where they can maximize their economic value and connecting them to the organization that enables such value.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Company
Our client is a Hong Kong listed company with principal activities in hospitality, property investment & development and the provision of management services across the region. They are looking to hire a Group Internal Auditor to be based in Singapore.

The Role
Reporting to Senior Manager, Group Internal Audit and you shall be responsible for executing audit projects (assurance/advisory/special audits) as assigned by the Senior Manager with the following scopes:
Deploy data analytics tools for targeted risk assessments and audit testing.
Perform and document process and operations review to identify weaknesses as well as opportunities for internal control improvements, best practices, and enhancements of business processes.
Conduct audit testing to evaluate the operating effectiveness of the existing controls, assessing the compliance with the applicable policies and recommend process improvements to address control gaps and to enhance efficiency where possible.
Draft findings and recommendations in report deliverables in a clear and concise manner.
Present findings confidently and succinctly to management in closing meetings.
Perform administrative duties as part of Internal Audit team and any other tasks as assigned.
You Profile
Minimum 2-3+ years of relevant working experience i.e. External/Internal Audit experience in a Big Four/Mid-Tier Accounting firm; experience in the hospitality industry is advantageous.
Experience in North America and Asia environment is preferred.
Degree in Accountancy or equivalent such as ACCA. Professional certification such as CPA, CIA, CISA or CFE is advantageous.
Basic knowledge and experience in financial and/or operational auditing and ability to identify and document processes weaknesses and key controls lapses.
Analytical and with an eye for details.
Self-motivated and independent, strong team player, thinking out of a box and a growth mindset.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, Outlook, Powerpoint, Access) with a general understanding of data analysis techniques (knowledge of Power Query is advantageous).
Excellent communication and writing skills in both English and Chinese in order to deal with Chinese stakeholders effectively for auditing entities in China.
Willingness to travel (up to 40%, 3 weeks for each project, at minimum) and flexibility to work beyond normal working hours in order to meet deadlines, as needed.

title: Senior / Speech Therapist*(5152) - Alexandra Hospital
company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. Our versatile and experienced team of healthcare professionals has only one aim - to help people get better, and live healthier and longer lives. We do this by improving medical care, lowering disease recurrence, producing better healthcare professionals, and turning research findings into better medical treatments for diseases that affect Singaporeans. And the reason we’re able to do these things is because we have the best and most dedicated people. Come join us and help shape medicine for our future.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview
The Speech Therapist is responsible for the assessment and management of patients referred to speech therapy. Under supervision, s/he will assist in areas such as clinical supervision, research, professional education and induction.

Primary Responsibility
• Assess and manage patients referred to speech therapy independently and implement appropriate treatment plans.
• Report to referring doctor and other members of the medical team.
• Document patient speech therapy records accurately.
• Charge patients accurately.
• Update individual performance statistical records regularly.
• Comply with clinical and service standards.
• Supervise TA in the workgroup.
• Practice within areas of professional competence and seek clinical support from supervisor / other healthcare professionals when appropriate.

Secondary Responsibility
• Collaborate with other healthcare members and participate in case conferences.
• Participate in clinical research.
• Carry out regular inventory / equipment checks.
• Assist in the review and update of clinical protocols and SOPs
• Assist in managing projects assigned to the workgroup.
• Participate in departmental QC and other activities, and to lead in some activities
• Assist in promoting / marketing clinical services.
• Assist in clinical education of speech therapy students.
• Assist in the induction of new speech therapists.
• Contribute to departmental inservice training programmes and hospital educational talks.
• Actively update speech therapy knowledge and skills

Requirements
• Recognised Degree in Speech therapy that is recognized in Singapore.
• Registered with the Allied Health Professions Council.
• Good communication and interpersonal skills.
• Service oriented and customer focused.
• Result oriented.
• Team worker.
• Competent in IT skills (Microsoft Excel / Word / Access / Powerpoint).
• Basic supervisory skills preferred.

If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Please indicate the position that you are interested in the subject heading.

title: Nurse Educator* (JR 301) - Alexandra Hospital
company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. Our versatile and experienced team of healthcare professionals has only one aim - to help people get better, and live healthier and longer lives. We do this by improving medical care, lowering disease recurrence, producing better healthcare professionals, and turning research findings into better medical treatments for diseases that affect Singaporeans. And the reason we’re able to do these things is because we have the best and most dedicated people. Come join us and help shape medicine for our future.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The job-holder assesses, identifies, implements, co-ordinates and evaluates departmental nursing staffs’ continuing education, training and development plans to ensure provision of competent and quality patient care. They are responsible for nursing staff induction, clinical education / training, in-service education, personal and professional growth.

Job Responsibilities
Primary Responsibilities:
Serves as resource person in education/nursing training matters and clinical issues to provide high quality standard of care
Plans and provides direct clinical supervision for nursing students and junior staff
Facilitates the clinical learning environment of nursing students to improve nursing students’ learning experiences
Monitors and evaluates nursing students’ feedback; develop action-plans collaboratively with ward nursing colleagues to improve nursing students’ learning experiences
Collaborates with education institution to ensure nursing students’ application of learning int- practice, e.g. hand hygiene compliance
Utilizes effective teaching strategies to develop critical thinking and clinical reasoning among nursing students, newly recruited nurses and nursing staff
Coaches preceptors and clinical instructor on their role effectiveness and assessment of nursing trainees and junior nurse’s performance e.g. formative and summative assessment, learning action plans
Conducts nursing staff orientation, training and continuing education programmes to maintain level of competency
Conducts learning needs analysis to identify learning gaps and training needs of nursing staff at ward/cluster level
Provides career counselling/coaching for all levels of nursing staffs’ professional development
Responsible to maintain and perform the following core competencies competently:
Clinical teaching / supervision
Structured teaching
Assessment of trainees and nurses’ clinical performance [formative & summative]
Reviews and revises existing curriculum following constructive recommendation on training/practice issues in order to meet the current educational needs of the hospital
Participates in the implementation and development of e-learning resources
Mentors and inducts potential acting nurse clinician for education track
Works collaboratively with ward/unit/cluster Nursing Officers and Senior Nursing Officers to [i] maintain clinical standards; [ii] conduct total performance management (includes career coaching and staff development) and [iii] assume joint managerial responsibilities, e.g. patient’s and / or family’s feedback, eHOR etc
Secondary Responsibilities:
Maintains clinical competency by seeking educational opportunities to maintain current knowledge and acquire new knowledge related to nursing practice
Collaborates with ward/cluster nursing leaders in nursing research initiatives/evidence-based practice to improve patient outcome
Participates in educational audit/quality improvement projects/risk management
Participates in nursing workgroup/committee at cluster/hospital level
Takes on additional responsibilities or tasks as assigned by the Senior Nurse Educator, Deputy/Assistant Director (Nursing) and Chief Nurse
Requirements
Registered Nurse with at least 9 years of post-registration clinical experience, of which a minimum of one (1) year experience in clinical teaching/professional development and continuing education at an acute hospital setting, and 2 years as Assistant Nurse Clinician
Diploma in Nursing with relevant post-basic advanced certification and Degree in Nursing from recognized training institution as approved by Singapore Nursing Board. A teaching qualification would be an advantage Interest t- teach nursing training and development activities
Good interpersonal and communication skills
Good computer skills and proficient in MS Office applications such as MS Word, MS Excel and PowerPoint
If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Please indicate the position that you are interested in the subject heading.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview
The job-holder is responsible to provide personalised, specialised and cost-effective care to patients, in accordance to established hospital policies and procedures, standards of nursing care and practices. He/ She is responsible for the effective and efficient running of the ward/department assigned.

Job Responsibilities
Primary Responsibilities:
• Assesses, plans, implements and evaluates care of patients with complex healthcare needs according to updated standards of nursing practice
• Ensures patient care delivery (inclusive of education and counselling) is carried out according to established standards of care practice using patient care plan / clinical pathways
• Co-ordinates patients’ access and treatment sequence where required for the specialty
• Conducts teaching and counselling for patients and their families / carers
• Initiates and ensures implementation of discharge planning for patients
• Leads and participates actively in the review of patients with the multidisciplinary team
• Follows up on patients at NUH specialist outpatient clinics where appropriate
• Conducts specialty nurse-led clinic for patients and their families where needed
• Provides clinical supervision to nurses and nurse trainees to ensure quality patient care delivery
• Updates and maintains patient consultation / training statistics / other types of register / registry where appropriate
• Applies understanding of prevention of medico-legal issues in relation to patient care
Secondary Responsibilities:
• Acts as a resource person for clinical nursing matters
• Plans, implements and evaluates in-service staff education and specialty training courses based on unit and individual training needs
• Inducts newly graduated advanced diploma nurses in specialty care of a specific group of patients
• Guides and develops specialty competencies of registered nurses
• Reviews and develops clinical pathways and / or other plans of care in consultation with specialty nurses, nurse managers, doctors and paramedical staff
• Reviews and develops practice policies and guidelines and nursing standards in consultation with specialty nurses, nurse managers and doctors
• Assists with nursing audits on nursing care standards
• Applies best evidence to practice
• Participates in research activities
• Undertakes quality improvement / research projects
• Participates in training / quality improvement / research committees
• Contributes to performance appraisals of enrolled nurses, senior enrolled nurses, staff nurses, senior staff nurses and advanced diploma nursing students
• Takes on additional responsibilities or tasks as assigned by Senior Nurse Manager/Clinician, Deputy/Assistant Director (Nursing) and Chief Nurse

Requirements
• Registered Nurse with at least 9 years of post-registration clinical experience, of which 2 years must be as Assistant Nurse Clinician
• Diploma in Nursing with relevant post-basic advanced certification and Degree in Nursing from recognized training institution as approved by Singapore Nursing Board.
• Technically skilled and competent
• Good interpersonal and communication skills
• Computer literacy skill – MS Word and PowerPoint

If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Please indicate the position that you are interested in the subject heading.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview
The job holder is responsible to provide sterile and reusable surgical instrument in accordance to established hospital policies and procedures. Supervise receiving, sorting, decontamination, inspection, packaging, sterilization, storage and distribution of the sterile items to operation theatres, SOC, in-patient wards and procedural rooms. He/ She is responsible for the efficient and smooth functioning of the Sterile Supplies Unit.

Job Responsibilities
Primary Responsibilities (80%):
• Direct clinical and service qualities activities
• Ensure staff practice required standards when carrying out their work
• Evaluate the effectiveness of sterilizer test indicators and ensure proper recording
• Lead, supervise, coach and support staff To deliver high standard of practices
• Ensure staff issues sterile supplies To all supporting areas on a timely manner
• Plan and prepares staff roster and assignment
• Conduct and evaluate audits on practices and standards. Initiate actions for improvement
• Ensure staff receive proper orientation, appropriate training and evaluate staff competency prior To them functioning independently in their roles
• Perform formative and summative assessment of staff in the department
• Facilitate team dynamics and the smooth running of activities within the SSU
• Act as a resource person liaison for training and standards of practices
• Evaluate and monitor efficient and effective use of equipment within the department
• Evaluate and monitor efficient and effective use of consumables and supplies
Secondary Responsibilities (20%):
• Supervise and guide junior staff in their work
• Participate in clinical and service quality activities
• Demonstrate awareness of current health care practices and standards
• Oversee and coordinate improvement projects To the department requirement. Facilitate and upgrade of IT system and ensure compliance in utilization among staff
• Assume additional responsibilities as assigned by Assistant/Deputy Director (Nursing) and Chief Nurse

Requirements
• Diploma in Engineering or relevant technical credentials. WSQ Higher Certificate in Healthcare Support (Sterilisation Services) will be an added advantage.
• Two years of working experience as Senior Instrument Technician with relevant experience in CSSD/ TSSU will be preferred
• Possess good inter-personal and supervisory skills
• Good command of written English and Knowledge of Microsoft Office

title: Medical Social Worker (5268) - Alexandra Hospital
company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. Our versatile and experienced team of healthcare professionals has only one aim - to help people get better, and live healthier and longer lives. We do this by improving medical care, lowering disease recurrence, producing better healthcare professionals, and turning research findings into better medical treatments for diseases that affect Singaporeans. And the reason we’re able to do these things is because we have the best and most dedicated people. Come join us and help shape medicine for our future.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Challenges

Your core duty involves direct practice and will include casework, care planning, counselling, financial assistance to patients and family members. You will work closely with multidisciplinary professionals, participate in ward rounds and organize and facilitate family conferences to pursue holistic care for patients. You will participate in practice research and development of clinical social work.
You will provide person-centred care with an understanding of the person in their own environment and working closely with formal and informal support networks to allow patients to be empowered in decisions they make or to work towards their wishes and wants.
You would also be expected to participate in community engagements to proactively deliver care to the patients and their families. Social work interventions may be centred out of the hospital to anchor care in the community.
You may also be assigned crisis intervention duties which would require priority responses and intensive case management to patients going through personal crisis, including attempted suicide or are victims of abuse.
Senior positions will require you to supervise colleagues, be a team leader, take on administrative roles and lead projects within the institution and the social work fraternity.
Medical disciplines you will work with : General Medicine, Renal Medicine, Rehab Medicine, Geriatric Medicine, Palliative Medicine and Psychological Medicine.

Services:
To provide counselling for patient and family in their understanding of the diagnosis & its implication on ADL functioning, preparing them for the implications on his overall care, coping with illness and recovery and financial needs.
To address patient’s and family’s acceptance of the diagnosis, change in roles, potential stresses and possible coping strategies with patient and family members, and to provide emotional support and motivate patient and family. Moving forward, to assist patient and family to set realistic and achievable goals.
To identify and make referral to appropriate services based on the multidisciplinary team’s assessment and patient’s social circumstances and social goals.
To explore and harness patient’s resources for the long term care plans. To facilitate family to make informed decisions, and ensure caregiver is competent and confident in the care before discharge home.
To make referrals for long term step-down facilities where necessary and eligible, and to arrange for interim care.
To participate in multidisciplinary ward rounds and case conferences to actively represent patients’ social, psychological and economic circumstances; to influence the team to act in the best interests of patients and families.
To provide support through end of life issues that patients and families may be facing and work through their grief and bereavement journeys.
Job Requirements:
Degree in Social Work; Post Graduate Diploma in Social Work; Master in Social Work
Post-graduate qualification in Counselling or Family Therapy will be an added advantage
Competent in IT skills and minimally bilingual
All qualifying staff will need to be Registered Social Workers with Singapore Association of Social Work
Committed and enjoy working as a team in a fast-paced, innovative and changing environment.
If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Please indicate the position that you are interested in the subject heading.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Stable Multinational Organization
Attractive Salary Package
About the Client
Our client is a Global Multinational Company in the Healthcare Industry. They have a well-established presence of more than 30 years with more than 5000 employees globally. With rapid expansion plans, they are now looking for a Technical Architect, to be a part of their team.

About the Job
As a Technical Architect, your job responsibilities involve:
Providing technical pre-sales consultancy in terms of IT hardware/software requirements, security policy, and connectivity
Driving project implementation for IT healthcare solutions
Designing and providing solutions for new prospects in network infrastructure, including switches, routers, firewalls, and VPNs.
Designing server configurations, both physical and virtual, running Windows and Linux operating systems.
Planning and supporting IT infrastructure projects, including upgrades and migrations.
Preparing documents and technical drawings for tender and local government/hospital processes.
Working closely with the Project Management team and cross functional business units to ensure smooth project implementation.
Skills and Experience required
As a successful candidate, you should have at least 6 years of working experience in a technical solutioning / architecture / design role for large scale medical IT solution implementation.
You should also have a strong experience with IT infrastructure such as Data centre Virtualisation (Vmware), Networks, and Databases coupled with a strong experience working with Hospital Information Systems (HIS).

Whats on offer
This is an exciting opportunity to join one of the market leaders in the Healthcare Industry as their Solutions Expert. You will get the opportunity to lead the design and technical solutioning for large scale end to end medical technology implementation.

company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview
The job-holder assesses, implements and evaluates infection control practices by nursing staff. The job-holder is responsible for staff education and competency in infection control.
Job Responsibilities
Primary Responsibilities:
Assesses, plans, implements and evaluates infection control practices of nursing staff, doctors and all healthcare workers in AH
Conducts teaching for nursing, paramedical and medical staffs and students in infection control practices and guidelines
Coordinates and collaborates with other healthcare team members and service providers on infection control practices and guidelines
Conducts and evaluates audits on infection control practices
Reviews and develops infection control policies and procedures in consultation with nurse managers, doctors and Infection Control Committee
Compiles information on epidemiological organism and nosocomial infection data and initiates actions where necessary
Reviews, records and completes data for reporting to the National Infection Prevention Committee, Ministry of Health
Carries out investigations, conducts follow-ups during major outbreaks in the unit and / or hospital
Plans, implements and evaluates in service talks and training courses / activities based on infection control
Ensures patient care delivery follows established standards of care and infection control policies
Applies understanding of prevention of medico-legal issues in relation to patient care
Prepares reports on infections and other related statistics required by AH, Medical Affairs (Quality Assurance) and / or MOH, and other departments upon requests
Secondary Responsibilities:
Acts as a resource person to nursing, medical, paramedics and administrative staff on issues relating to outbreaks and infection control issues. Reports to relevant hospital / medical administrators when required
Updates and maintains relevant infection control statistics
Participates / leads in quality improvement / research projects
Participates / leads in unit-based infection control team
Mentors newly appointed Nurse Clinicians
Follows up with accidental sharps / mucus membrane exposures to blood and body fluids
Informs and notifies wards and relevant staff / or government authority of patients with communicable disease
Assists in arranging prompt isolation of infected patients in co-operation with nursing managers / nursing staff
Updates and implements hospital infection control policy in consultation with Chairman and the Infection Prevention Committee
Conducts orientation programs for nursing staff and students
Takes on additional responsibilities or tasks as assigned by the Senior Nurse Clinician, Deputy/Assistant Director (Nursing) and Chief Nurse
Requirements:
Registered Nurse with at least 9 years of post-registration clinical experience, of which 2 years must be as Assistant Nurse Clinician
Diploma in Nursing with relevant post-basic advanced certification and Degree in Nursing from recognized training institution as approved by Singapore Nursing Board, and certification / prior working experience for a year in infection control.
Technically skilled, competent and able to work independently
Good interpersonal and communication skills
Computer literacy skills –MS Word, MS Excel and PowerPoint

Roles & Responsibilities
Overview
You will be responsible to assist the nursing team in providing personalized, specialised and cost-effective care to the patients in accordance to established hospital policies and procedures, standards of nursing care and practices.

Job Responsibilities
·Implements protective measures to prevent injury due to chemical, electrical, laser, mechanical, radiation, and thermal sources
· Transport the patient according to individual needs and evaluates for signs and symptoms of skin and tissue injury related to transfer or transport
· Determines the need for, prepares, applies, and remove devices designed to enhance operative exposure, prevent neuromuscular injury, maintain skin and tissue integrity, and maintain body alignment and optimal physiological functioning
· Uses supplies and equipment within safe parameters
· Performs required counts ensuring that patient is free from injury related to retained sponges, instruments, and sharps
· Evaluates for signs and symptoms of chemical, electrical, laser, physical, and radiation injury and injury to skin and tissue
· Contributes to minimizing operative time by anticipation and advanced preparation, working with tem members to coordinate efforts to prioritize the patient’s care, and efficiently accomplishing tasks necessary to achieve a common goal
· Implement aseptic technique (e.g. crating and maintain a sterile field, applying basic methodologies to prevent contamination of open wounds, and isolating the operative site from the surrounding non-sterile physical environment)
· Initiates infection prevention activities
· Manages collection, handling, and disposition of culture and specimen
· Administer prescribed medications and solutions according to hospital policy

Requirements
· Enrolled Nurse with the Singapore Nursing Board (SNB)
· Recognised Enrolled Nurse Certificate or equivalent as approved by SNB
· At least 2 years of Operating Theatre experience is highly preferred
· Good interpersonal and communication skills
· Compassionate, positive and caring nature
· Prepared to work on 3 rotating shifts

If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Please indicate the position that you are interested in the subject heading.

title: Assistant Director (Biomedical Engineering), Eastern General Hospital Planning Office
company_info: SINGAPORE HEALTH SERVICES PTE LTD
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The upcoming Eastern General Hospital (EGH) aspires to provide excellent, patient-centred care and to improve the health of the population in the east of Singapore. We aim to develop future-ready systems to support patients’ healthcare journeys and to be an employer of choice for our staff.

You will support the Development Secretariat and Hospital Planning Committee (HPC) to set up the Biomedical Engineering (BME) department and ensure project execution, budget and quality of the development are in accordance with the established programme. This will include end-user briefings, operations requirements, systems design with technology partners, establish guidelines and project timelines. You will lead in the development and review of related policies and procedures to ensure compliance against regulatory framework. In addition, you will ensure optimal utilisation of financial and manpower resources and liaise with key stakeholders on procurement requirements for the projects. You will also support, participate and lead in BME cluster shared service key initiatives and workgroups.

Requirements
Recognised degree in Electronic Engineering, Electrical Engineering or Biomedical Engineering or related fields
Minimum 12 years of related work experience in hospital operations, preferably in a healthcare sector
Knowledge and skill in design thinking, change management, project management, technology adoption and process methodologies
Possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills and the ability to engage various stakeholders in a fluid environment and a growing organisation
Team player, highly motivated and action-oriented with excellent planning, analytical and critical thinking skills
Able to work under pressure, adapt to change and manage challenges
Familiar with Autocad, Photoshop and presentation software
Must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19

title: Assistant Nurse Clinician (Infection Control)* (JR 299) - Alexandra Hospital
company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. Our versatile and experienced team of healthcare professionals has only one aim - to help people get better, and live healthier and longer lives. We do this by improving medical care, lowering disease recurrence, producing better healthcare professionals, and turning research findings into better medical treatments for diseases that affect Singaporeans. And the reason we’re able to do these things is because we have the best and most dedicated people. Come join us and help shape medicine for our future.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview
The job-holder assesses, implements and evaluates infection control practices by nursing staff. The job-holder is responsible for staff education and competency in infection control.

Job Responsibilities
Primary Responsibilities:
- Assesses, plans, implements and evaluates infection control practices of nursing staff, doctors and all healthcare workers in AH
- Conducts teaching for nursing, paramedical and medical staffs and students in infection control practices and guidelines
- Coordinates and collaborates with other healthcare team members and service providers on infection control practices and guidelines
- Participates and assist with audits on infection control practices
- Reviews and develops infection control policies and procedures in consultation with nurse managers, doctors and Infection Prevention Committee
- Compiles information on epidemiological organism and nosocomial infection data and assist with the initiation of actions where necessary
- Carries out investigations, conducts follow-ups during major outbreaks in the unit and / or hospital
- Plans, implements and evaluates in service talks and training courses / activities based on infection control policies
- Ensures patient care delivery follows established standards of care and infection control policies
- Applies understanding of prevention of medico-legal issues in relation to patient care
- Assist to prepare reports on infections and other related statistics required by AH, Medical Affairs (Quality Assurance) and / or MOH, and other departments upon requests
Secondary Responsibilities:
- Acts as a resource person t- nursing, medical, paramedics and administrative staff on issues relating to outbreaks and infection control issues. Reports to relevant hospital / medical administrators when required
- Updates and maintains relevant infection control statistics
- Participates / leads in quality improvement / research projects
- Participates / leads in unit-based infection control team
- Follows up with accidental sharps / mucus membrane exposures to blood and body fluids
- Informs and notifies wards and relevant staff / or government authority of patients with communicable disease
- Assists in arranging prompt isolation of infected patients in co-operation with nursing managers / nursing staff
- Participates / conducts orientation programs for nursing staff and students
- Assumes additional responsibilities or tasks as assigned by the Nurse Clinician, Deputy/Assistant Director (Nursing) and Chief Nurse

Requirements
- Registered Nurse with at least 7 years of post-registration clinical experience, of which 2 years must be as Senior Staff Nurse I
- Diploma in Nursing with relevant post-basic advanced certification and Degree in Nursing from recognized training institution as approved by Singapore Nursing Board, and certification / prior working experience for a year in infection control.
- Technically skilled, competent and able to work independently
- Good interpersonal and communication skills
- Computer literacy skills –MS Word, MS Excel and PowerPoint
If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Please indicate the position that you are interested in the subject heading.
