description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Purpose

The Executive Assistant/ Senior Executive Assistant is to provide the main administrative support for assigned Allied Health departments.

Duties and Responsibilities
2.1 Primary Responsibilities and Duties (80%)
Manages department roster (on an assigned frequency)
Co-ordinate meetings, book venues, collate agenda and arrange for catering requirements when necessary.
Facilitate on-boarding of new staff; raising system and tap card accesses, coordinate on-board process, follow up issues with HR (if any)
Collate and update relevant data required by the department for purposes of cost management and improvement.
Handle purchase and work requisition processes, from calling suppliers for quotation to submitting invoices to Finance for payment.
Reconcile dropped charge reports for assigned department.
Assist in audit reviews by providing requested documents to relevant auditors
Handles procurement-related documentations (i.e. Purchase Requests, Sourcing Requests, Approval To Procure papers etc.)
2.2 Secondary Responsibilities and Duties (20%)
Collect and despatch documents from/to areas within hospital premises.
Requisite, control and maintain good utilisation of office supplies in the department.
Record and produce meeting minutes
Manage gift packs for storage and distribution.
Perform any other duties assigned by supervisor.
Job Specification
Diploma in healthcare-related/management courses (preferred)
Minimum 2 years of experience in clerical and administrative duties.
A good understanding of accounting and figures.
Good computer skills in Word, Excel and Power Point and SAP system
Critical thinking and problem-solving ability
Adaptable and able to work independently
If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Please indicate the position that you are interested in the subject heading.

title: Senior / Project Engineer (Smart Systems Planning), Eastern General Hospital Planning Office
company_info: SINGAPORE HEALTH SERVICES PTE LTD
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The upcoming Eastern General Hospital (EGH) aspires to provide excellent, patient-centred care and to improve the health of the population in the east of Singapore. We aim to develop future-ready systems to support patients’ healthcare journeys and to be an employer of choice for our staff.

You will engage users, planning teams and partners to leverage technologies to create a productive and high-performing workplace for staff and a good experience for patients and their families at the new EGH. You will also ensure the smooth operations of the EGH Healthcare Living Lab (HLL) with the Development Secretariat, perform integration testing, plan pilots, and engage the multi-disciplinary teams to ensure the smooth implementation of these technologies in the new hospital. You will also work in a team to do research and development for the operation of intelligent systems for healthcare.

Requirements
· Bachelor’s Degree in Computing, Electrical and Electronics Engineering or equivalent
· At least 3 years’ experience in software programming /engineering / integration work
· Good knowledge in electrical circuitry and PLC
· Familiar with quick prototyping tools such as Unity/Wire framing/Solidworks
· Familiar with management of engineering collaboration platforms such as SLACKS/ GitHUB
· Knowledge in software development with robotic platforms, SLAM or related fields
· Experience in the following is preferred:
1. Robot Operating Systems (ROS), Gazebo, Unity, Linux,OpenCV
2. Robotics perception, LIDAR, object tracking, motion planning, machine learning sensor fusion and system engineering
3. Embedded and real-time systems
4. Algorithm development in C/C++, Python, Unix shell scripting
· Team player with excellent planning, analytical and communication skills
· Possess critical thinking skills and willing to think outside of the box.
· Action-oriented, highly motivated with the ability to work under pressure and adapt to challenging conditions
· Must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview
The job holder is responsible to provide sterile and reusable surgical instrument and equipment by demonstrating competence in all aspects of sterile processing: Supervise receiving, sorting, decontamination, inspection, packaging, sterilization, storage and distribution of the sterile items to operation theatres, SOC, in-patient wards and procedural rooms. Ensure smooth functioning of the Theatre Sterile Supplies Unit.

Job Responsibilities
Primary Responsibilities (80%):
• Ensure daily smooth functioning of the TSSU in receive, sort, decontaminate, inspect, pack, sterilize, storage and distribute surgical items
• Ensure staff practice the standards of Loads and operates washer-disinfectors, dryers, ultrasonic washer and sterilizers
• Perform and evaluate sterilizer test indicators
• Perform inventory of all sterile linen and surgical consumables supplies
• Issue sterile supplies To all supporting areas on a timely manner
• Keep tract of preventive maintenance (PM) of washer disinfectors, dryers, ultrasonic washer, and sterilizers and ensure all PM are up To date
• Perform cleaning of TSSU storage area
• Demonstrate proper use and care of equipment
• Report defective equipment and take appropriate action To repair or replace
• Identify and notifies In-Charge of instruments that need To be repaired/ replaced
• Liaise with OT nurses on the consignment sets required for procedures
• Facilitate team dynamics and the smooth running of activities within the TSSU
• Communicate and handover essential information and critical events To colleagues in-charge and supervisor
Secondary Responsibilities (20%):
• Supervise and guide junior staff in their work
• Participate in clinical and service quality activities
• Demonstrate awareness of current health care practices
• Assist in keeping instrument tracking data and system up To date
• Assume additional responsibilities as assigned by Senior Instrument Technician, Instrument Specialist and Assistant/Deputy Director (Nursing)

Requirements
• Diploma in Engineering or relevant technical credentials. WSQ Higher Certificate in Healthcare Support (Sterilisation Services) will be an added advantage.
• One year of working experience as Instrument Technical Assistant or relevant experience in CSSD/ TSSU will be preferred
• Possess good inter-personal and supervisory skills
• Good command of written English and Knowledge of Microsoft Office
If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Please indicate the position that you are interested in the subject heading.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview
The job-holder is responsible for the quality of patient care delivered and the standard of nursing practice in an assigned ward/unit. S/he provides highly skilled and specialized nursing care to specific patient population and their caregivers.
Job Responsibilities
Primary Responsibilities:
· Assesses, plans, implements and evaluates care of patients with complex healthcare needs according to updated standards of nursing practice
· Ensures patient care delivery (inclusive of education and counselling) is carried out according to established standards of care practice using patient care plan / clinical pathways
· Co-ordinates patients’ access and treatment sequence where required for the specialty
· Conducts teaching and counselling for patients and their families / carers
· Initiates and ensures implementation of discharge planning for patients
· Leads and participates actively in the review of patients with the multidisciplinary team
· Follows up on patients at NUH specialist outpatient clinics where appropriate
· Conducts specialty nurse-led clinic for patients and their families where needed
· Provides clinical supervision to nurses and nurse trainees to ensure quality patient care delivery
· Updates and maintains patient consultation / training statistics / other types of register / registry where appropriate
· Applies understanding of prevention of medico-legal issues in relation to patient care
Secondary Responsibilities:
· Acts as a resource person for clinical nursing matters
· Plans, implements and evaluates in-service staff education and specialty training courses based on unit and individual training needs
· Inducts newly graduated advanced diploma nurses in specialty care of a specific group of patients
· Guides and develops specialty competencies of registered nurses
· Reviews and develops clinical pathways and / or other plans of care in consultation with specialty nurses, nurse managers, doctors and paramedical staff
· Reviews and develops practice policies and guidelines and nursing standards in consultation with specialty nurses, nurse managers and doctors
· Assists with nursing audits on nursing care standards
· Applies best evidence to practice
· Participates in research activities
· Undertakes quality improvement / research projects
· Participates in training / quality improvement / research committees
· Contributes to performance appraisals of enrolled nurses, senior enrolled nurses, staff nurses, senior staff nurses and advanced diploma nursing students
· Takes on additional responsibilities or tasks as assigned by Senior Nurse Manager/Clinician, Deputy/Assistant Director (Nursing) and Chief Nurse
Requirements
· Registered Nurse with at least 9 years of post-registration clinical experience, of which 2 years must be as Assistant Nurse Clinician
· Diploma in Nursing with relevant post-basic advanced certification and Degree in Nursing from recognized training institution as approved by Singapore Nursing Board.
· Technically skilled and competent
· Good interpersonal and communication skills
· Computer literacy skill – MS Word and PowerPoint

title: Guest Services Officer (Serviced Apartments / Hospitality)
company_info: Ariva on Shan Serviced Residences located at 12 Shan Road Singapore 328105. Nestled in the charming street along Shan Road within an attractive location connected by city conveniences on foot, car and the MRT, Ariva on Shan evokes a nest of warmth and retreat whilst being sited in a lively urban neighbourhood. Ariva on Shan’s choice location provides convenience in every way possible, with amenities of every kind at the doorstep. A few minutes on foot will bring you to a myriad of food choices along a vibrant stretch of shophouses while shopping malls such as Novena Square, United Square and Velocity, pulsate with more dining and retail options. The buzz of the city is never too far away as you are close to Novena MRT Station, just two stops away from Orchard MRT Station, and easy connectivity to the rest of Singapore via the CTE and the PIE.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:
Perform all Front Desk-related duties including but not limited to prompt and efficient check-in and check-out of guests, credit checks, guest folio checks, and guest profile maintenance professionally in accordance with the company’s policies and procedures.
Create and update new room bookings in the system, send out guest confirmations, make any necessary amendments and cancellations in the system.
Receives and transmits messages and/or postal letters to guests promptly.

Coordinating and multi-tasking job duties in a busy environment.
Professional in demeanour, presentation, personable, enthusiastic, self-motivated and able to work independently.

Ensure that Front Desk is not left unmanned at all times.

Enhance the guest experience and to ensure conformance to stated objectives, standards, statutory requirements, policies and procedures.
Handle guest queries/comments/complaints professionally and refer and irregularities/issues to Management, when necessary.

title: Associate Medical Laboratory Technologist (5300) - Alexandra Hospital
company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. Our versatile and experienced team of healthcare professionals has only one aim - to help people get better, and live healthier and longer lives. We do this by improving medical care, lowering disease recurrence, producing better healthcare professionals, and turning research findings into better medical treatments for diseases that affect Singaporeans. And the reason we’re able to do these things is because we have the best and most dedicated people. Come join us and help shape medicine for our future.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Purpose
The Associate Medical Laboratory Technologist is responsible for performing laboratory diagnostic procedures and related activities so as to provide a quality laboratory service to our customers, both internal and external.

Duties and Responsibilities
Primary Responsibilities and Duties (80%)
Receive laboratory specimens and reject those that are unsuitable for analysis.
Operate the Laboratory Information System to perform functions such as result query, order entry and result entry.
Perform all procedures in accordance with laboratory protocols.
Alert appropriate laboratory personnel of critical values.
Receive and resolve queries from customers.
Notify appropriate laboratory personnel when laboratory instruments malfunction.
Undertake preventative maintenance on laboratory instrumentation.
Notify appropriate laboratory personnel when test kits, reagents or other supplies should be re-ordered.
Comply with good laboratory practice as set out by the Laboratory Accreditation Programme of the College of American Pathologists and Singapore regulatory agencies such as the Medical Audit & Accreditation Unit.
Comply with all requirements of the Laboratory Safety Manual.
Report any adverse incidents to senior member of staff.
Perform shift duties as required.
Keep current with new instrumentation, techniques and procedures by attending/participating in appropriate workshops, seminars and in-service education classes.
Promptly carry out the instruction(s) of senior staff with regard to work procedures and duties.
Secondary Duties and Responsibilities (20%)
2.2.1 Evaluate new laboratory test methodologies.
2.2.2 Demonstrate laboratory procedures to trainees and new staff.
2.2.3 Guide Laboratory Technicians, Clerical Staff and Health Attendants in their work when required.
2.2.4 Participate in routine laboratory administrative work such as filing, processing of delivery orders and invoices.
2.2.5 Any other duties as assigned by supervisor.

Job Specification / Requirements
Diploma in Medical laboratory Science or related subject and good laboratory skills.
Above average dexterity with good general health and no colour blindness
Basic computer literacy
Good communication skills.
Service orientated and customer focused
Able to perform 3 rotating shifts (morning, afternoon, night)
If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Please indicate the position that you are interested in the subject heading.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview
The job holder is responsible to provide sterile and reusable surgical instrument and equipment by demonstrating competence in all aspects of sterile processing: Receiving, sorting, decontamination, inspection, packaging, sterilization, storage and distribution of the sterile items to operation theatres, SOC, in-patient wards and procedural rooms.
Job Responsibilities
Primary Responsibilities (80%):
· Receive, sort, decontaminate, inspect, pack, sterilize, storage and distribute surgical items
· Load and operate washer-disinfectors, dryers, ultrasonic washer and sterilizers
· Perform and evaluate sterilizer test indicators
· Perform inventory of all sterile linen and surgical consumables supplies
· Issue sterile supplies to all ORs
· Perform cleaning of TSSU storage area
· Demonstrate proper use and care of equipment
· Report defective equipment and take appropriate action to repair or replace
· Identify and notifies In-charge of instruments that need to be repaired/ replaced
· Ensure daily cleaning of Decom area
· Facilitate smooth running of activities within the TSSU
· Communicate and handover essential information and critical events to colleagues in-charge
Secondary Responsibilities (20%):
· Participate in clinical and service quality activities as required
· Demonstrate awareness of current health care practices
Requirements
· ITE in Engineering, relevant technical credentials or WSQ Higher Certificate in Healthcare Support (Sterilisation Services)
· Preferable with working experience as Instrument Technical Assistant or relevant experience in CSSD/ TSSU
· Possess good inter-personal and supervisory skills
· Good command of written English and Simple Knowledge of Microsoft Office

title: Operating Theatre Technician (JR 295) - Alexandra Hospital
company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview
The job-holder is responsible to provide a safe and clean environment for the surgical patient.

Job Responsibilities
Primary Responsibilities (80%):
• Check the suction and diathermy machines for cleanliness and good working order
• Check operating lights for clarity and good functioning
• Clean, check and prepare operating table and accessories
• Prepare the operating room for each patient scheduled on the operating list
• Assist in the safe transfer of patient from trolley to operating table and vice versa
• Assist in positioning the patient
• Assist surgeon in application of tourniquet
• Adjust and focus the operating lights and assist nurses in patient care
• Perform daily inventory check on positioning aids and accessories
• Perform cleaning of the operating room in between cases within 15mins
• Clear soiled linen and surgical wastes to the disposal room after the next case had started or when necessary time allows
• Ensure that the disposable suction liner is capped tightly before discarding into the biohazard bag
• Maintain proper housekeeping of OT suite which include operating room, prep-room, scrub room, Anaes room and sluice room daily
• Do terminal cleaning at the end of the list or after infected cases as stated in the protocol
• To stay in the operating room to assist the surgical team when needed, eg. Change the suction liner, additional adhoc equipment needed etc
Secondary Responsibilities (20%):
• Maintain proper housekeeping of pantry
• Transport patient from the ward to OT and vice versa
• Perform routine cleaning of OT equipment e.g. tourniquet, light source etc weekly
• Perform any other duties as assigned

Requirements
• WSQ Higher Certificate in Healthcare Support (Operating Theatre Support) or relevant working experience as an Operating Theatre Technician
• Possess initiative and keen to learn
• Possess good interpersonal and communication skills

If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Please indicate the position that you are interested in the subject heading.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview
The job holder is responsible to provide quality sterile and reusable surgical instrument and equipment by demonstrating competence in all aspects of sterile processing: Receiving, sorting, decontamination, inspection, packaging, sterilization, storage and distribution of the sterile items to operation theatres, SOC, in-patient wards and procedural rooms. Able to troubleshoot and repair a variety of diagnostic and therapeutic biomedical equipment to maximize equipment availability of patient care. To report directly to Instrument Specialist In-charge for any operation issues.

Job Responsibilities
Primary Responsibilities (80%):
• Receive, sort, decontaminate, inspect, pack, sterilize, storage and distribute surgical items
• Load and operate washer-disinfectors, dryers, ultrasonic washer and sterilizers
• Monitor and evaluate sterilizer test indicators. Ensure records are kept up to date
• Perform inventory check of all sterile linen and surgical consumables supplies
• Ensure sterile supplies are supplied to all supporting area on a timely manner
• Keep tract of preventive maintenance (PM) of washer disinfectors, dryers, ultrasonic washer, and sterilizers and ensure all PM are up to date. Ensure records are up to date for audit purposes
• Assist in rostering of staff and assign assignments on a daily basis
• Demonstrate proper use and care of equipment
• Report defective equipment and take appropriate action to repair or replace
• Identify and notify supervisor in charge of instruments that need to be repaired/ replaced
• Liaise with OT nurses on the consignment sets needed for procedures
• Facilitate team dynamics and the smooth running of activities within the TSSU
• Communicate and handover essential information and critical events to instrument specialist and supervisor in charge
Secondary Responsibilities (20%):

• Demonstrate awareness of current health care practices

title: Radiographer*(4441) - Alexandra Hospital
company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. Our versatile and experienced team of healthcare professionals has only one aim - to help people get better, and live healthier and longer lives. We do this by improving medical care, lowering disease recurrence, producing better healthcare professionals, and turning research findings into better medical treatments for diseases that affect Singaporeans. And the reason we’re able to do these things is because we have the best and most dedicated people. Come join us and help shape medicine for our future.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview
As a Senior / Radiographer, you are responsible for the routine management and administration of a section within the department. You will also be responsible for supervising, coaching and training radiographers and other staff members to render high quality imaging services.

Job Responsibilities

Primary Responsibilities (80%)
Perform clinical duties in general radiography and at least one advanced imaging modality (CT / MRI / Ultrasound / Mammography / Interventional Radiology)
Perform IV cannulation and administer contrast media for radiological examinations, where required
Oversee the smooth operations within his/her section of specialised area and ensure proper usage and care of equipment of the section at all times
Ensure quality assurance programmes are implemented and observed as well as initiate system improvement within the section
Adhere to safe work practices especially in radiation safety and infection control
Conduct training and coaching of radiographers
Render prompt and courteous service delivery to external and internal customers
Handle difficult situations like patients’ complaints and queries within the department / section promptly and effectively
Ensure efficient patient turnaround time per examination
Plan, organise and prioritise assigned tasks such that all are completed effectively and on time
Motivate and counsel team members on personal and work related issues. Build upon their strengths and help improve their weaknesses for desired results
Secondary Responsibilities (20%)
Maintain and upkeep a section with efficient work performance
Collate and prepare statistical data of the section
Ensure physical environment and ambience of work place adheres to corporate standards
Perform any other duties as assigned by reporting officer
Requirements
Allied Health Professions Council (AHPC) registration
Recognised Degree or Diploma in Diagnostic Radiography
5 years specialised experience in Mammography / Ultrasound / CT / MRI / Interventional Radiology preferred
Strong leadership qualities
Compassionate and good patient care
Good interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
Customer and service oriented
Computer skills in word processing, spreadsheet and presentation software
If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Please indicate the position that you are interested in the subject heading.

The Therapy Assistant is to provide assistance to therapists in clinical, administrative and technical duties and to assist in the supervision of healthcare attendants.

Assist in setting up inventory list of equipment / supplies / forms.
Perform inventory checks of equipment / supplies / forms.

Team worker

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Responsibility:
Provide counselling for patient and family on understanding of the diagnosis and implication, preparing them for the implications on overall care, coping with illness and recovery and financial needs.
Address acceptance of the diagnosis, potential stresses and possible coping strategies with patient and family members, and to provide emotional support and motivate patient and family.
To assist patient and family to set realistic and achievable goals.
Identify and make referral to appropriate services based on the multidisciplinary team's assessment and patient's social circumstances and social goals.
Harness resources of patient for the long term care plans. Facilitate family to make informed decisions, and ensure caregiver is competent and confident in the care before discharging.
Make referrals for long term step-down facilities where necessary and eligible, and to arrange for interim care.
Participate in multidisciplinary ward rounds and case conferences to actively represent patients' social, psychological and economic circumstances to influence the team to act in the best interests of patients and families.
Provide support through end of life issues that patients and families may be facing and work through grief and bereavement journeys.
Job Requirements:
Degree in Social Work Post Graduate Diploma in Social Work Master in Social Work
Post-graduate qualification in Counselling or Family Therapy will be an added advantage
Competent in IT skills
Registered Social Workers with Singapore Association of Social Work
Committed and enjoy working as a team in a fast-paced, innovative and changing environment.

title: Hospitality Associate
company_info: Marcy’s is a restaurant set amidst the backdrop of Duxton, a seafood bistro at heart that takes familiar ideas and presents them in new, satisfying ways. Marcy’s strives to chart the tide for restaurant culture in Singapore, with inventive yet hearty food, disarmingly relaxed service and an eclectic and atmospheric setting that all set the stage for an experience like no other. Here at Marcy’s, we are anchored in being all real, all the time, for those who don't chase luxury, but who live it by elevating moments, indulging their senses and celebrating the everyday.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for a spirited individual passionate about hospitality to join the team. Although very much valued, F&B experience is not required. We are looking for someone with a positive attitude who values working in a nurturing environment.
This role involves a variety of tasks, mainly to do with setting up the restaurant, and providing outstanding service and hospitality to our guests. We're looking for individuals who thrive when interacting with others and making meaningful connections.
Applications are open to all, and we look forward to hearing from you!
Who are we?
Marcy’s is a restaurant set amidst the backdrop of Duxton, a seafood bistro at heart that takes familiar ideas and presents them in new, satisfying ways. We draw greatly on the similarities between Latin American and Southeast Asian ingredients, showcasing the best local and regional herbs, spices and aromatics, paired with seafood in bold new ways. · Great working hours (evenings only and no split shifts)
· 44 hours a week, 2 days off, 5 day work weeks!
· Daily staff meal
· Late night transport
· Peers and Managers that will help you settle in and grow

title: Senior Patient Service Associate(5224) -Alexandra Hospital
company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. Our versatile and experienced team of healthcare professionals has only one aim - to help people get better, and live healthier and longer lives. We do this by improving medical care, lowering disease recurrence, producing better healthcare professionals, and turning research findings into better medical treatments for diseases that affect Singaporeans. And the reason we’re able to do these things is because we have the best and most dedicated people. Come join us and help shape medicine for our future.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As a Patient Service Associate in our wards, you will deliver friendly and efficient customer service and create a warm and welcoming atmosphere for all internal and external customers / patients, with the key aim of providing excellent patient care and satisfaction.
Duties & Responsibilities
Handle admission, discharge and transferring of patients into wards, which includes creating and maintaining proper personal records of patients without compromising any data and safety breaches.
Making internal and external appointments for patients as per ordered by doctors.
Ensure ward’s operational and procedural area readiness based on desired service standards.
Provide basic financial counselling to patient and next-of-kin when requested.
Manage stock inventory within the assigned ward.
Provide chaperone assistance to doctors/nurses and prepare consultation documents.
Perform any other ad-hoc duties and responsibilities that may be assigned from time to time.
Requirements
Minimum GCE “O” Levels qualification or equivalent.
Proficient in computer skills (Microsoft Office), handling multiple systems such as SAP will be an advantage.
Team player with good communication, customer service and interpersonal skills. Ability to speak a second language will be an advantage.
Able to multitask and work in a fast-paced environment.
Candidates should be comfortable/flexible with working in a hospital setting and in different clinics when needed. Prior experience in hospitality or service industries will be an advantage.
Working schedule: 5 days’ work week (Monday to Sunday, including Public Holidays) on rotating shifts. Earliest shift starts from 8am to 5:30pm, and latest shift starts from 12pm to 9:30pm.
This is a 2-year contract role, subjected to contract extension or permanent conversion with satisfactory work performance.
If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Please indicate the position that you are interested in the subject heading.

title: Facilities Manager (Hospital Facilities)
company_info: ENGIE Services Singapore Pte Ltd (ENGIE), is a leading provider of Integrated Facilities Management solutions (IFM), property management, operation and maintenance, specialised rail engineering works, sustainable solutions and FM Consultancy services. The company operates across a wide spectrum of mission-critical industries and markets, including aviation, transportation, healthcare, education, government and commercial projects. With more than 30 clients all over Singapore, 4 decade of experience in facilities management and specialised engineering services and with over 1,100 direct staff, ENGIE consistently delivers best-in-class service standards, offers reliable support and proven expertise in managing mission-critical facilities and operations for our clients. ENGIE Services Singapore is part of the ENGIE group, a global energy player and an expert operator in the three key sectors of electricity, natural gas and energy services. The Group supports changes in society that are based as much on economic growth as on, social progress and the preservation of natural resources. · With our proven track records as a one-stop integrated facilities and specialised engineering specialist, we conduct trainings and continuous skill upgrading to our technical staff as well as vendors / partners supporting the project; · Monitor & reviewing of monthly key performance indicators with our clients, through a strong governance structure; · High performance management and effective technical operation in collaboration with specialist contractor / vendors; · Implement crisis management and recovery; · Provide active roles in the initiatives on Environmental, Health and Safety (EHS) programmes; · Schedule and forecast of annual planned maintenance work and schedules to ensure seamless service delivery. About ENGIE Group ENGIE develops its businesses (power, natural gas, energy services) around a model based on responsible growth to take on the major challenges of energy’s transition to a low-carbon economy: access to sustainable energy, climate-change mitigation and adaptation and the rational use of resources. The Group provides individuals, cities and businesses with highly efficient and innovative solutions largely based on its expertise in four key sectors: renewable energy, energy efficiency, liquefied natural gas and digital technology. ENGIE employs 154,950 people worldwide and achieved revenues of €69.9 billion in 2015. The Group is listed on the Paris and Brussels stock exchanges (ENGI) and is represented in the main international indices: CAC 40, BEL 20, DJ Euro Stoxx 50, Euronext 100, FTSE Eurotop 100, MSCI Europe, DJSI World, DJSI Europe and Euronext Vigeo (Eurozone 120, Europe 120 and France 20). Specialties Energy Audit, ESD Consultancy, Project Management, Facility Services, Energy Efficiency Performance Contract, Data Centre Services, Street Lighting Services, Integrated Facilities Management
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As a Facilities Manager, you will oversee the facility management and maintenance activities of a healthcare facility. You will be leading an on-site facilities team of engineers, technical officers and technicians in providing facilities management service to the client.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Oversee and lead a team in facility management for a healthcare facility.
Study, propose and implement feasible improvement works.
Oversee and coordinate rectification works, major repairs and maintenance works, and new initiatives.
Oversee the daily, weekly, and monthly reports for submission to the client
Lead and manage a multi-disciplined team of engineers, technical officers, and technicians.
Ensure compliance with company guidelines and authorities requirements.
JOB REQUIREMENT
Bachelor's degree in Mechanical/Electrical Engineering or equivalent from a recognized university
Minimum 10 years of relevant working experience
Minimum 3 years of prior Healthcare experience required
Proven experience in facility management in a large-scale facility
Strong building and M&E knowledge with hands-on experiences
Interpersonal skills to develop good working relationships with client and stakeholders
Possess leadership and people management skills to manage a multi-disciplined team
Good communication skills, both verbal and written
Ability to remain flexible and organized in a fast-paced environment
Possess a high level of initiative and integrity
Service-oriented mindset
Has a good safety mindset and displays good WSH behavior

Job Description

Assisting in improving team management and corporate culture through training the members.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
Company is a surgical kit supplier and a solution provider to improve the efficiency and profitability of Operating Theatre (OT) in acute hospitals.
As a solution provider, this position is expected to act as not only sales person but also consultant for solutions.
Solution approach;
1. Meet with all stakeholders such as OT nurses, Surgeons, MMD, and management and/or conduct on-site survey to identify the pain points and issues from the viewpoints of 1) utilization of OT, 2) Productivity of OT nurses and 3) Optimization of SCM etc.
2. Develop proposal on Company solutions to address their pain points depending on each stakeholder.
3. Actually attend the surgery site, discuss the optimal preparation and procedure with the Surgeons and Nurse for developing most suitable customized surgical kit in order to address their pain points.
<Responsibilities>
Meet up with all stakeholders at acute hospitals to make good relationship and promote Company solutions and products.
Negotiate and sell Company solutions and products to hospitals with the local distributor.

Job Requirement
• Bachelor’s Degree required
• 3 years’ experience as sales person in medical device sector and/or as OT nurses in SG (better to have experiences in Orthopedic surgery, Neuro-surgery, cardiac surgery and general surgery)
• Logical thinking and Creativity to come up with solution proposals depending on customers’ pain points and issues etc.
• Kaizen mind /Willingness to make the thing better
• Possess positive attitude and good interpersonal skills.
• Results-oriented, meticulous and a self-motivated team player

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About the company
My client is one of the leading household entertainment lifestyle brands that is also renowned internationally. They have since expanded their brand into the West and are looking further strengthen their presence in the rest of Asia-Pacific.

As part of their growth, they are looking for a driven and passionate individual to execute their membership retention , customer satisfaction strategies through regular engagement and fostering strong relationships and creating a unique customer experience.

About the role
Reporting to the Head of Membership Relations , your responsibilities includes
Working closely with management to develop and implement strategies to be aligned with overall “s business strategy and growth plans
You will regularly engage with existing and potential members on promotional events, activities and special rates to encourage repeat business and increase revenue per member ratio
This is done by fostering strong relationships and creating a unique and personalized experience as well as acting as the main point of contact for inquiries, concerns, feedback and ensuring that members are well informed and taken good care of
You will be tasked with analyzing membership data and trends to identify opportunities for growth and improvement and identifying dormant members and find ways to engage them
Track and report on key performance indicators relations to membership engagement and retention
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align membership programs with organizational goals and working closely with internal teams to ensure a cohesive member experience
Skills and experience required
Experience in a similar role in entertainment, nightlife and hospitality industry
Strong people skills with the ability to engage people of different backgrounds and cultures and being able to build and maintain relationships with members
Ability to create personalized experience and relationships to each unique members with strong passion and desire to be in the nightlife/entertainment industry
If you are interested in the position, please click “apply” David Lerh (EA:94C3609/ R1769977)

company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. Our versatile and experienced team of healthcare professionals has only one aim - to help people get better, and live healthier and longer lives. We do this by improving medical care, lowering disease recurrence, producing better healthcare professionals, and turning research findings into better medical treatments for diseases that affect Singaporeans. And the reason we’re able to do these things is because we have the best and most dedicated people. Come join us and help shape medicine for our future.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As a Patient Service Associate in the Ambulatory Surgery Ward, you will deliver friendly and efficient customer service and create a warm and welcoming atmosphere for all internal and external customers / patients, with the key aim of providing excellent patient care and satisfaction.

Duties & Responsibilities

• Ensure clinic’s operational and procedural area readiness based on desired service standards.
• Assist with smooth patient journey including accurate and timely registration, discharge, appointment bookings, cashiering and any other enquiries such as insurance provider’s information for billing.
• Perform cashiering duties, attend to and manage patients’ enquiries
• Attend to any requests, emails and phone enquiries.
• Provide chaperone assistance to doctors/nurses and prepare consultation documents
• Assist clinic manager in administrative duties
• Perform any other ad-hoc duties and responsibilities that may be assigned from time to time

Requirements

• Candidate must possess at least “O” Levels/Diploma.
• Proficient in computer skills (Microsoft Office), handling multiple systems such as SAP will be an advantage.
• Team player with good communication, customer service and interpersonal skills. Ability to speak a second language will be an advantage.
• Able to multitask and work in a fast-paced environment.
• Candidates should be comfortable/flexible with working in a hospital setting and in different clinics when needed. Prior experience in hospitality or service industries will be an advantage.
• Be comfortable with working in inpatient wards.
• Able to perform 2 rotating shifts (morning & afternoon).

company_info: THE SUPREME HR ADVISORY PTE. LTD. Here at The Supreme HR Advisory, we pride ourselves on being a vibrant recruitment firm with strong Southeast Asia standing. We believe in customizing our services to cater to your unique needs. We are dedicated, enthusiastic and we take innovative approaches in customizing our services. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Sales Representative (Medical Device) | Staff Nurse Background | Islandwide GP & Hospital

Working Hours: 8.30/9am to 5.30/6pm
Working Days: Mon to Fri
Working Location: Islandwide GP & Hospital
Salary Basic: $2500 - $5000 + Commission + Allowances

Job Scope:
Sell medical products, systems or services to achieve sales targets for assigned territories and overall business objectives.
Call and meet with existing and prospective customers including general practitioners (GPs), hospital doctors, nurses, and hospital teams to make presentations in order to persuade to use Company's medical devices.
Conduct product demonstrations and emphasize saleable features/customer benefits.
Implement action plans to achieve sales targets for assigned territories.
Provide all necessary on-site technical expertise, knowledge and support to any medical team including all surgeons, nurses, anaesthetists throughout the entire medical procedure in the operating theatre.
Report on the activities and products of the competitors.
Maintain relevant customer data, and record sales data for reporting and tracking purposes. in appropriate customer relationship management databases.
Be fully responsible and accountable of the consignment stock and assist the logistics team to ensure that the consignment stock at respective locations are regularly checked and accurate.
Conduct product training to customers including but not limited to distributors, medical professional, doctors, nurses in assigned territories.
Have a good knowledge of all products which the Company currently distributes or any other products that the Company may distribute.
Identify business opportunities, formulates account strategies & ensure effective implementation of territory action plans.
Work with management to consistently build trust, credibility and consistently strong customer demand and preference for products and services including building Key Opinion Leaders in respective accounts.
Drives advocacy for products by ensuring up-to-date knowledge of both product and clinical evidence to hospital customers, and by providing the necessary clinical support in the respective accounts.
Coordinate payment collection following company’s SOP.
Provide regular market/competitor updates.
Prompt complaints handling adhering to company SOP.
Assisting customers enquiries and provide quotation as needed.
Participate in the Company’s workshops, coordination of all exhibitions which the Company is involved, and market the Company’s products.
Requirements:
Minimum 2 years of sales experience in Medical Devices.
Comfortable working in an Operating Theatre.
Nursing background is a plus.
Knowledge of MS Office.
Ability to travel locally (to and from clients) on a daily basis.

title: Pharmacy Technician*(4663) - Alexandra Hospital
company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. Our versatile and experienced team of healthcare professionals has only one aim - to help people get better, and live healthier and longer lives. We do this by improving medical care, lowering disease recurrence, producing better healthcare professionals, and turning research findings into better medical treatments for diseases that affect Singaporeans. And the reason we’re able to do these things is because we have the best and most dedicated people. Come join us and help shape medicine for our future.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview
Perform technical duties under the supervision of pharmacists to ensure safe, efficient and timely distribution of drugs in AH.
Assist the pharmacist in-charge to provide supervision to pharmacy support staff and to coordinate activities within a section to ensure smooth workflow and continuous improvement.
Dispense medicines to the patients according to department policies and guidelines.
Job Responsibilities
1) Daily Operations
Provide professional and courteous service to all patients/customers
Process medication orders/prescriptions for both inpatient and outpatient
Picking, packing and labelling in accordance with stipulated policies, guidelines and department standard operating procedures
Perform billing functions
Ensures work area is ready for daily operations
Maintains the cleanliness of the pharmacy and ward areas where drugs are stored
Involvement in workplace quality improvement projects/activities as and when required
2) Inventory Management
Ensures stocks are stocked up properly and tidily according to First-Expiry-First-Out (FEFO) requirement and stipulated storage condition
Performs topping up of omnicell ward stock in the respective wards
Ensures correct receiving of goods
Secondary repackaging/redressing
Carry out cycle counts and stock takes periodically according to SOPs
3) Dispensing
Dispensing of medications to patients in accordance with stipulated policies, guidelines and department standard operating procedures
Requirements
Possess Certified Pharmacy Technician Certification (CPTC) OR Diploma in Pharmaceutical Science
Completed Basic Skill Test OR Certified Pharmacy Technician Certification (CPTC)
Have initiative and able to work independently to achieve goals of the department
Able to communicate effectively
Able to function effectively as member of a team
Flexibility to work on weekends/ public holidays occasionally

title: Dental Surgery Assistant*(4673) - Alexandra Hospital
company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. Our versatile and experienced team of healthcare professionals has only one aim - to help people get better, and live healthier and longer lives. We do this by improving medical care, lowering disease recurrence, producing better healthcare professionals, and turning research findings into better medical treatments for diseases that affect Singaporeans. And the reason we’re able to do these things is because we have the best and most dedicated people. Come join us and help shape medicine for our future.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As a Dental Surgery Assistant, you will work with stakeholders to deliver friendly and safe care to patients with the key aim of providing excellent patient care and satisfaction.
Duties & Responsibilities
• Help patient feel comfortable before, during and after dental treatment.
• Maintain patient medical and treatment records and dentists' listing to ensure smooth flow of patients.
• Assist in providing patient care information and instructions prescribed by Dentist to patient e.g. Post op instructions, oral hygiene instructions Responsible to prepare and setup instrument trays and materials required ready for dental procedures
• To assist dentist during dental procedures, providing proper instruments and assistance to facilitate patient care.
• To assist in taking and developing dental diagnostic x-rays.
• Assist dentist in management of medical and dental emergencies.
• Assist to handle and manage patient's feedback.
• Check and disinfect used instruments in the clinic.
• Check , pack and sterilize instruments/ instrument sets in the department.
• Ensure timeliness and constant.
• Clinic rooms' materials are availability of sterile instruments / instrument sets for daily use in the department.
• Ensure proper disinfection and maintenance of dental chairs, equipment, working surfaces and instruments.
• Report any incidences such as malfunction, defects or loss of instruments and equipment promptly.
• Ensure proper inventory and storage of all instruments and supplies in accordance to first in, first out (FIFO) principle.
• Provide orientation and guidance for new hire.
• Assist in compilation and submission of clinic statistics.
• To conduct OJT and audit on a team of Dental Assistants on work processes and grooming standards.
• To plan and assign staff coverage for lunch, urgent leave or medical leave.
• Any other assigned duties by supervisors.
Requirements
• Minimum GCE "O" Level or equivalent
• Healthcare experiences with Certificate in Dental Assistant Course preferred
• Possess good interpersonal and communication skills
• At least 2 years of relevant working experience
• Standing for long hours
• Possible exposure to radiation when assisting in x-ray taking

title: Dental Surgery Assistant*(4674) - Alexandra Hospital
company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. Our versatile and experienced team of healthcare professionals has only one aim - to help people get better, and live healthier and longer lives. We do this by improving medical care, lowering disease recurrence, producing better healthcare professionals, and turning research findings into better medical treatments for diseases that affect Singaporeans. And the reason we’re able to do these things is because we have the best and most dedicated people. Come join us and help shape medicine for our future.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As a Dental Surgery Assistant, you will work with stakeholders to deliver friendly and safe care to patients with the key aim of providing excellent patient care and satisfaction.
Duties & Responsibilities
• Help patient feel comfortable before, during and after dental treatment.
• Maintain patient medical and treatment records and dentists' listing to ensure smooth flow of patients.
• Assist in providing patient care information and instructions prescribed by Dentist to patient e.g. Post op instructions, oral hygiene instructions Responsible to prepare and setup instrument trays and materials required ready for dental procedures
• To assist dentist during dental procedures, providing proper instruments and assistance to facilitate patient care.
• To assist in taking and developing dental diagnostic x-rays.
• Assist dentist in management of medical and dental emergencies.
• Assist to handle and manage patient's feedback.
• Check and disinfect used instruments in the clinic.
• Check , pack and sterilize instruments/ instrument sets in the department.
• Ensure timeliness and constant.
• Clinic rooms' materials are availability of sterile instruments / instrument sets for daily use in the department.
• Ensure proper disinfection and maintenance of dental chairs, equipment, working surfaces and instruments.
• Report any incidences such as malfunction, defects or loss of instruments and equipment promptly.
• Ensure proper inventory and storage of all instruments and supplies in accordance to first in, first out (FIFO) principle.
• Provide orientation and guidance for new hire.
• Assist in compilation and submission of clinic statistics.
• To conduct OJT and audit on a team of Dental Assistants on work processes and grooming standards.
• To plan and assign staff coverage for lunch, urgent leave or medical leave.
• Any other assigned duties by supervisors.
Requirements
• Minimum GCE "O" Level or equivalent
• Healthcare experiences with Certificate in Dental Assistant Course preferred
• Possess good interpersonal and communication skills
• At least 2 years of relevant working experience
• Standing for long hours
• Possible exposure to radiation when assisting in x-ray taking
If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Please indicate the position that you are interested in the subject heading

title: Mechanical Supervisor (Hospital Facilities)
company_info: ENGIE Services Singapore Pte Ltd (ENGIE), is a leading provider of Integrated Facilities Management solutions (IFM), property management, operation and maintenance, specialised rail engineering works, sustainable solutions and FM Consultancy services. The company operates across a wide spectrum of mission-critical industries and markets, including aviation, transportation, healthcare, education, government and commercial projects. With more than 30 clients all over Singapore, 4 decade of experience in facilities management and specialised engineering services and with over 1,100 direct staff, ENGIE consistently delivers best-in-class service standards, offers reliable support and proven expertise in managing mission-critical facilities and operations for our clients. ENGIE Services Singapore is part of the ENGIE group, a global energy player and an expert operator in the three key sectors of electricity, natural gas and energy services. The Group supports changes in society that are based as much on economic growth as on, social progress and the preservation of natural resources. · With our proven track records as a one-stop integrated facilities and specialised engineering specialist, we conduct trainings and continuous skill upgrading to our technical staff as well as vendors / partners supporting the project; · Monitor & reviewing of monthly key performance indicators with our clients, through a strong governance structure; · High performance management and effective technical operation in collaboration with specialist contractor / vendors; · Implement crisis management and recovery; · Provide active roles in the initiatives on Environmental, Health and Safety (EHS) programmes; · Schedule and forecast of annual planned maintenance work and schedules to ensure seamless service delivery. About ENGIE Group ENGIE develops its businesses (power, natural gas, energy services) around a model based on responsible growth to take on the major challenges of energy’s transition to a low-carbon economy: access to sustainable energy, climate-change mitigation and adaptation and the rational use of resources. The Group provides individuals, cities and businesses with highly efficient and innovative solutions largely based on its expertise in four key sectors: renewable energy, energy efficiency, liquefied natural gas and digital technology. ENGIE employs 154,950 people worldwide and achieved revenues of €69.9 billion in 2015. The Group is listed on the Paris and Brussels stock exchanges (ENGI) and is represented in the main international indices: CAC 40, BEL 20, DJ Euro Stoxx 50, Euronext 100, FTSE Eurotop 100, MSCI Europe, DJSI World, DJSI Europe and Euronext Vigeo (Eurozone 120, Europe 120 and France 20). Specialties Energy Audit, ESD Consultancy, Project Management, Facility Services, Energy Efficiency Performance Contract, Data Centre Services, Street Lighting Services, Integrated Facilities Management

title: Nurse Manager (Hospital)
company_info: Kingfisher Recruitment Group is a global provider of Executive Search, Recruitment Process Outsourcing (RPO) and Leadership / Talent Assessment Solutions. Established since 2002, we help clients design people strategies, attract and develop talents worldwide across Healthcare / Life Sciences, Professional Services, Technology, Retail / Luxury / FMCG, Manufacturing, Automobile, Property & Construction and Engineering industries. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Summary
Responsible to provide personalised, specialised and cost-effective care to patients, in accordance to established hospital policies and procedures, standards of nursing care and practices. Ensure effective and efficient running of the ward/department assigned.

Job Responsibilities

Primary Responsibilities:
Assesses, plans, implements and evaluates care of patients
Ensures patient care delivery is carried out according to established standards of care practice using patient care plan / clinical pathways
Co-ordinates patients’ access and treatment sequence where required for the specialty
Conducts teaching and counselling for patients and their families / carers
Initiates and ensures implementation of discharge planning for patients
Leads and participates actively in the review of patients with the multidisciplinary team
Conducts specialty nurse-led clinic for patients and their families where needed
Provides clinical supervision to nurses and nurse trainees to ensure quality patient care delivery
Updates and maintains patient consultation / training statistics / other types of register / registry where appropriate
Applies understanding of prevention of medico-legal issues in relation to patient care
Secondary Responsibilities:
Acts as a resource person for clinical nursing matters
Plans, implements and evaluates in-service staff education and specialty training courses based on unit and individual training needs
Inducts newly graduated advanced diploma nurses in specialty care of a specific group of patients
Guides and develops specialty competencies of registered nurses
Reviews and develops clinical pathways and / or other plans of care in consultation with specialty nurses, nurse managers, doctors and paramedical staff
Reviews and develops practice policies and guidelines and nursing standards in consultation with specialty nurses, nurse managers and doctors
Assists with nursing audits on nursing care standards
Applies best evidence to practice
Participates in research activities
Undertakes quality improvement / research projects
Participates in training / quality improvement / research committees
Contributes to performance appraisals of enrolled nurses, senior enrolled nurses, staff nurses, senior staff nurses and advanced diploma nursing students
Takes on additional responsibilities or tasks as assigned by Senior Nurse Manager/Clinician, Deputy/Assistant Director (Nursing) and Chief Nurse
Requirements
Registered Nurse with at least 9 years of post-registration clinical experience, of which 2 years must be as Assistant Nurse Clinician
Diploma in Nursing with relevant post-basic advanced certification and Degree in Nursing from recognized training institution as approved by Singapore Nursing Board.

Summary

title: Senior Patient Service Associate (Bed Management Unit)* (5114) - Alexandra Hospital
company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. Our versatile and experienced team of healthcare professionals has only one aim - to help people get better, and live healthier and longer lives. We do this by improving medical care, lowering disease recurrence, producing better healthcare professionals, and turning research findings into better medical treatments for diseases that affect Singaporeans. And the reason we’re able to do these things is because we have the best and most dedicated people. Come join us and help shape medicine for our future.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview
The Bed Management Unit (BMU) plays an important and significant role in overseeing all daily admissions, transfers and bed management, maximizing bed capacity in Alexandra Hospital. This position will coordinate and provide efficient and clinically appropriate ward placement of all patients according to patient’s needs, choice of class based on urgency and type of admission.
The Ambulance Management Unit (AMU) sits within BMU manages the hospital ambulance services and coordinates the transfer of patient to/from medical facilities in emergency and non-emergency situations. This position involves coordination with various stakeholders like the clinical team, nursing team and ambulance vendors for ambulance arrangement to fetch/send patient from/to hospitals, residence and nursing home.
This team also provides on-time and accurate Emergency Code Activation to alert the emergency response team to any medical emergency within AH.
Effective and clear communications are required between all parties involved in the process of bed planning and ambulance transfer coordination.
Job Responsibilities
You will be responsible for the following:
Bed Management Operations
Performs daily bed management by coordinating with various stakeholders and team members on all types of admissions and transfers to assign beds to patients in accordance to set of protocol, policy and procedures.
Ensure effective utilization of capacity, constantly matching demand and supply.
Able to identify potential bed tight situation and activate bed tight measures.
Provide statistics and reports of bed and resource utilization to management and bed availability to other institutions.
Perform continuous review of workflows, systems and procedures to identify areas for improvement.
Teamwork and networking with key stakeholders
Ø Liaise and work effectively with wards, other institutions emergency department and BMU for all admissions and transfers within/across the hospital.
Clear understanding of all admitting workflows
Ø Understand all point of access into the Hospital for patients and be able to deal with competing interests.
Ambulance Service Management Operations
Arrange ambulance transfer for patients to/from hospitals/ residence/ nursing home and coordinate with requestors and ambulance vendors to ensure any special arrangements are communicated correctly.
Take ownership in complying with MOH Emergency Ambulance Services standard and guidelines, confidentiality and procurement policies.
Ensure all ambulance transfers are recorded to provide statistic and reports on ambulance utilization, transfer type, etc. for analysis.
Ability to manage ambulance vendors effectively and efficiently.
Perform continuous review of workflows and procedures to identify areas for improvement.
Assist with feedback and escalate in a timely manner.
Improve Service Standards and Performance measurement:
Ø Accurate and timely activation of ambulance transfers for patients.
Ø Activates the right ambulance service according to the needs of the patient.
Emergency Activation
Activates Emergency Response Team to respond to life emergency within AH
Participate in daily Code Blue testing and monthly Code Blue drills.
Administrative Duties
To assist bed request and ambulance transfer enquiries/request via phone, email or fax and follow up on closure.
Conduct testing of applications when necessary.
Comply with Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA) to ensure patient confidentiality are safe-guarded.
Participate in activities that contribute towards the improvement of patient care, including professional development sessions to build relevant areas of knowledge, skills and attitudes.
Involve and engaged in ad-hoc projects as assigned by Reporting Officer.
Requirements
Qualification Required and Area of Discipline· GCE O levels/A levels/Nitec/Higher Nitec/Diploma from any disciplineRequired Competencies and Capabilities (Skills, Experiences and Professional Licences)• Strong analytical, communication and interpersonal skills with positive “can do” attitude.• Team player with natural ability to interact with healthcare team of all levels.• Pleasant disposition, approachable, independent worker, have initiative and drive to resolve issues.• Comfortable with ambiguity, unchartered territory, enjoy challenges and problem solving.• Able to perform 3 rotating shifts (includes night shifts, weekends and public holidays).
If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Please indicate the position that you are interested in the subject heading.

title: Business Controller (Hospitality - Resort Operations)
company_info: Morgan Philips Group is radically changing the headhunting, recruitment and talent consulting business with a range of modern, innovative service lines designed to succeed in the new world of work. Our approach to combining high-touch consultancy with worldwide search capability and digital sourcing technologies means we are in a strong position to offer organisations a range of talent solutions, including executive search, talent consulting, temporary and permanent recruitment, outplacement, managed solutions and interim management.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
You will be joining leading entity in the hospitality industry, renowned for delivering unparalleled resort experiences to guests globally.
Our client is actively seeking a dynamic Business Controller to bolster their resort operations segment. This assistant-level role calls for an individual adept in supervising the vast array of products managed by their purchasing teams. Given that each category boasts over a thousand items, the incumbent will be analytically inclined, skillfully overseeing costs to guarantee maximum value without forsaking quality.
Responsibilities:
Operational Oversight: Command daily resort functions, ensuring harmonious liaison across departments.
Cost Analysis: Delve deep into the selection arena of the purchasing teams, reviewing costs and affirming best practices and value enhancement.
Budget Management: Monitor and curate departmental budgets, advocating efficient resource allocation.
Product Line Management: Steward a vast and intricate product repertoire, maintaining the gold standard of quality whilst optimizing expenditure.
Collaboration: Engage synergistically with purchasing divisions, gathering insights into product decisions, vendor alignments, and procurement methodologies.
Reporting: Craft regular reports encompassing cost analytics, budget distribution, and procurement tendencies for senior management appraisal.
Continuous Improvement: Identify avenues for process refinement and cost reductions, coordinating with relevant teams for actualization.
Qualifications and Experience:
A Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, or its equivalent.
Proven experience of 3-5 years in a similar role, preferably within the hospitality domain.
Acute analytical acumen with the competence to manage expansive datasets and product ranges.
Stellar communication skills, facilitating seamless interaction with multiple internal teams and stakeholders.
Proficiency in financial tools and platforms for budgeting and cost assessment.
Salary range $75,000 to $80,000 annually.
If you are keen to know more, please click on the Apply button or reach out to me at chloe.lim@morganphilips.com.

title: Pharmacy Technician (JR4388) - Alexandra Hospital
company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. Our versatile and experienced team of healthcare professionals has only one aim - to help people get better, and live healthier and longer lives. We do this by improving medical care, lowering disease recurrence, producing better healthcare professionals, and turning research findings into better medical treatments for diseases that affect Singaporeans. And the reason we’re able to do these things is because we have the best and most dedicated people. Come join us and help shape medicine for our future.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview
Performs technical duties under the supervision of pharmacists and pharmacist technicians to ensure safe, efficient and timely distribution of drugs in AH.

Job Responsibilities
1) Daily Operations
Provide professional and courteous service to all patients/customers
Process medication orders/prescriptions for both inpatient and outpatient
Picking, packing and labelling in accordance with stipulated policies, guidelines and department standard operating procedures
Perform billing functions
Ensures work area is ready for daily operations
Maintains the cleanliness of the pharmacy and ward areas where drugs are stored
Involvement in workplace quality improvement projects/activities as and when required
Cashiering duties
2) Inventory Management
Ensures stocks are stocked up properly and tidily according to First-Expiry-First-Out (FEFO) requirement and stipulated storage condition
Performs topping up of omnicell ward stock in the respective wards
Ensures correct receiving of goods
Secondary repackaging/redressing
Carry out cycle counts and stock takes periodically according to SOPs
Requirements
Minimum O Levels qualification
Understands and usage of the in-house computer systems
Able to work independently with minimum supervision and have good initiative

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About the Role
The Supervisor reports to the Executive/ Assistant Contract Manager/ Contract Manager and is responsible for his/ her subordinates who are the Senior Facility Services Specialist, Facility Services Specialist, housekeepers, project staff and team leader.
Job Responsibilities
Project a professional image at all times.
Practice Greet, Smile and Thank (GST) patients, staff and all who come into contact.
Ensure the team complies with grooming standards and adhere on Health & Safety requirements in respect of uniforms and safety work practices as well as procedures to provide a clean, safe working environment.
Check and update daily attendance of staff reporting for duty and deploy staff to respective area and ensure that all areas are adequately manned.
Conduct daily briefing and provide reminders and to ensure that staff are up to date with daily information and instructions.
Conduct daily inspections of all areas including rooms under supervision to ensure that all Environmental Services assignments are carried through.
Coordinate fault reporting and repairs between ward staff, housekeepers and FME department. Troubleshoot equipment malfunctions.
Review and ensure completion of maintenance cleaning requests is completed within the specified standards, and within the agreed time frame and frequency.
Ensure that staff supervised is issued with appropriate tools and equipment in excellent working condition to undertake their duties.
Check and update records of cleaning materials such as bath mats and mops submitted by housekeepers. Ensure sufficient stocks at all times.
Check daily reports (e.g. FSS Daily Reports, Housekeepers Daily Worksheet, Turnover Time, etc) and follow up accordingly.
Keep track on overtime performed by housekeepers, calculate and submit the details to admin office (payroll) for processing and payment (twice monthly)
Prepare and maintain records of staff supervised (i.e. timesheets, tasks records, materials and clothing issues, etc).
Prepare and submit daily/ weekly/ monthly reports and customer feedback records.
Coach and train staff in need so that their performance would meet standards stipulated.
Conduct performance appraisal, recommend for promotion or increment for deserving staff.
Enforce safety rules and regulations. Promptly report accidents/ incidents to the superior without delay.
Coordinate customers’ feedback and requests and ensure that there is a follow up to the complaints and requests.
Conduct patient satisfaction interviews with patients.
Attend and participate in staff meetings and training to keep track with changes in cleaning procedures and disseminate such information to staff under supervision.
Undertake any duties/ projects, etc as and when requested by the Assistant Contract Manager/ Contract Manager.
Job Requirements
Secondary School Education or closely related field with minimum 3 or more years of supervisory experiences with emphasis on complete cleaning in a hospital environment, large facility services industry or large commercial contracts.
Candidates without the above minimum requirements on education but with relevant experiences can be considered for the position.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced challenging hospital environment and with the ability to organize, manage, supervising a small group of staff for facility services projects.
Require long periods of standing, walking, bending when inspection of walk and ability to follow oral instructions, read and comprehend written instructions to carry out assignments.
Knowledge of training of buffer, vacuum, shampooer and other cleaning activities will be an added advantage.
Able to commit to 6 days work week(Rotating off day) | 7.30am - 3.45pm or 1.15pm - 9.30pm(Rotating shift).

At ISS we deliver a wide range of self-performed services that can be combined in numerous ways according to the customer’s requirements. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Projects a professional image at all times.
Delivers quality portering services to patients and staff in the hospital.
Provides portering services which include but not limited to patients, medical records, specimen, equipment, medication and blood products to and from the wards/ specialist clinics/ departments/ external centres in a safe and professional manner.
Assists in the reception of patients by provision of wheelchairs/trolleys and their transfer from ambulance and to ensure proper transfer and lifting techniques are practiced when transferring patients.
Maintains proper filling system for purpose of submission of daily tasks.
Leads a team of porters and ensures supervision, grooming, motivation, discipline, and training to the team.
Conducts training, provides guidance and coach staff to raise competency level.
Disseminates information where necessary and provides feedback to supervisor on cases of interest.
Engages users on a periodic basis, updates supervisors on their concerns and addresses them.
Attends to inquiries from internal staff / external persons immediately and gives appropriate advice if applicable.
Manning telephone hotlines, receives requests from users via e-porter system and assigns tasks to staff.
Reports any faults in the e-porter system and furnish suggestions to improve system performance.
Ensures that the equipments / mobile devices are in good working conditions at all times and report any defects.
Prepares and maintains daily roster, daily attendance, and periodic reports.
Collects and consolidates all medical certificate submission, leave application forms, and ensures that all documents are in order prior to submission.
Ensures tidiness and cleanliness of workplace and / or shared areas of work with other staff.
Monitors all Health, Safety & Environmental procedures and practices, reports incidents to supervisor immediately whenever an incident happens, conducts investigation on such matters, and drafts incident report.
Responds to hospital or civil emergency activations (eg. call tree, hospital decontamination station, Kingfisher activation, etc) while on duty or/and off duty (standby).
Undertakes any other duties/ activities/ projects, etc. as and when instructed by the supervisor or management.
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Candidate should posses at least an ITE Cert, Diploma, any field
At least 1 years(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Without experience are welcome to apply
Training will be provided
Basic IT knowledge is required to handle e-system, computer, smartphones
Applicants must be willing to work in Singapore General Hospital
Preferably Non-Executives specializing in General Work (Housekeeper, Driver, Dispatch, Messenger, etc), or Healthcare (Medical Support, Assistant or equivalent)
Working Days: 5-6 days a week
Able to work overtime (when required)

Job applicants need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated
