title: Senior Project Manager (Hospitality)
company_info: EDG DESIGN - ASIA PTE. LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Reports to: Project Director/Principal

Description:

Responsible for planning, coordinating and administering a major project or several small projects through all phases of design. Structures and manages the project team to ensure cost-effective operations and project management flow for all projects. Establishes budgets and prepares schedules appropriate to the project’s scope of work, especially manpower costs in relation to fees.Working with others in project Leadership (typically a Lead Designer). Oversees all phases including schematic design, design development and production of working drawings and construction documents on a given project. Has client contact and responsibility to direct, control and monitor all project activities.

Duties and responsibilities:

Responsibility for client contact

Speaks for the firm proactively and professionally in dealing with client.
Obtains timely approvals and decisions from client that allows the project to flow smoothly and efficiently through the office.
Assists Project Director/ Principal to changes in scope, lack of information or decisions from client that affect schedule or production costs.

Analyzes project scope and organizes project workflow.

1. Determines the skills required of other team members for the project.
2. Develops integrated tasks to accomplish individual projects.
3. Participates in the selection of project team members.
4. Schedules the project, using project schedule forms and timelines.
5. Responsible for weekly project meetings, projecting staff scheduling and requirements and schedule posting.
6. Assists in preparing project budgets prior to project start.
7. Maintains contact with project team(s) while travelling.

Review and management of projects.

1. Monitors the progress of the project to determine percentage of completion versus money spent for each phase of the project.
2. Checks for conformance to contract terms, schedule and construction costs.
3. Reports to Project Principal on a mutually established schedule.
4. Reviews and approves project staff time charges.
5. Responsible for completing project on time, monitoring project costs against budget and for identifying and charging for additional services (Variation Orders).

Addresses quality of project.

1. Establishes project quality standard with project team.
2. Assists in the preparation of “in-house” standards.

Plans and/or supervises planning of project staff requirements for each project.

1. Assigns project personnel to specific responsibilities or tasks.
2. Produces or coordinates production of project Phase Goal sheets and associated work plans per week.
3. Sees that project team’s time meets utilization goals.
4. Coordinates and monitors the technical efforts of all project members.
5. Provides planning direction and supervision in all aspects of project to all members of project team.

Closes out projects.

1. Responsible for turning all documents over to administration staff for entry into firm’s archive files, including project information, accounting information and original constructions documents.

Responsible for personal and staff development

1. Participates in professional organizations.
2. Performs senior staff development duties such as mentoring, training, supervising and directing junior staff.
3. Participates in management and leadership groups.

Works with the Managing Director/Principal on business development activities.

1. Assists in preparation of fee proposals and contractual agreements, if required.
2. Attend ad hoc client meetings or industry conferences/events as required.

Education: Degree in Interior Design or Architecture from an accredited university.

Proficiency in some or all of the following:
- MS Office, particularly Excel
- MS Project
- AutoCAD
- SketchUp
- Online project management platforms (Aconex, etc.)
- Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop etc.)

title: Pharmacy Assistant(4664) - Alexandra Hospital
company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. Our versatile and experienced team of healthcare professionals has only one aim - to help people get better, and live healthier and longer lives. We do this by improving medical care, lowering disease recurrence, producing better healthcare professionals, and turning research findings into better medical treatments for diseases that affect Singaporeans. And the reason we’re able to do these things is because we have the best and most dedicated people. Come join us and help shape medicine for our future.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview
Performs technical duties under the supervision of pharmacists and pharmacist technicians to ensure safe, efficient and timely distribution of drugs in AH.

Job Responsibilities
1) Daily Operations
Provide professional and courteous service to all patients/customers
Process medication orders/prescriptions for both inpatient and outpatient
Picking, packing and labelling in accordance with stipulated policies, guidelines and department standard operating procedures
Perform billing functions
Ensures work area is ready for daily operations
Maintains the cleanliness of the pharmacy and ward areas where drugs are stored
Involvement in workplace quality improvement projects/activities as and when required
Cashiering duties
2) Inventory Management
Ensures stocks are stocked up properly and tidily according to First-Expiry-First-Out (FEFO) requirement and stipulated storage condition
Performs topping up of omnicell ward stock in the respective wards
Ensures correct receiving of goods
Secondary repackaging/redressing
Carry out cycle counts and stock takes periodically according to SOPs
Requirements
Minimum O Levels qualification
Understands and usage of the in-house computer systems
Able to work independently with minimum supervision and have good initiative
Able to communicate effectively
Able to function effectively as a member of a team
Flexibility to work on weekends/ public holidays occasionally
If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Please indicate the position that you are interested in the subject heading

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Attend multi-disciplinary meetings with medical staff, nurses and other healthcare professionals to discuss, propose and coordinate care plans for residents.
Design and develop relevant programmes on psycho-socio care that promote quality care that look at well-being of resident.
Counsel resident and their family members on psycho-socio care plans
Liaise with organisations that provide services to meet residents’ and their families’ needs, and refer them to community support organisations if necessary.
Focus on family-centred care by encouraging participation among residents' family members.
Active participation in visiting residents at wards and join organization/residents' related events.
Identify gaps and streamline work processes within organization and service deliveries related to care and needs of residents and families.
Advocate for changes with relevant stakeholders to enhance the care and well-being of residents.
To keep up to date with the latest government guidelines on healthcare and social service programs, funding schemes available within the community/ sector.
Develop the ability to work with different levels of internal colleagues to foster close liaison on issues arising and/or feedback related to residents.
Participate as part of the Multi-disciplinary Case Assessment Team (MCAT) assessors to conduct residents' pre-admission assessment.
Establish and confirm source of social facts shown in the social background of all new applicants
Manage Medifund administration and applications in collaborations with Finance Dept.
Administer renewals of residents' funding schemes when needed,
Develop and monitor the social wellness care plan of residents
Develop discharge care plan for residents if their health condition is fit for discharge
Any other duties as assigned by Reporting Manager/Supervisor.
Requirements:
Candidate must possess a Degree in Social Work
At least 1 - 3 years of relevant healthcare industry experience
Demonstrate initiative to identify, plan, develop and implement resourcefulness to find solutions to missing gaps in work processes

company_info: Resorts World Sentosa (RWS), Asia’s premium lifestyle destination resort, is located on Singapore’s resort island of Sentosa. Spanning 49 hectares, RWS is home to world-class attractions including Universal Studios Singapore, S.E.A. Aquarium, the Maritime Experiential Museum, Dolphin Island and Adventure Cove Waterpark. Complementing the adventure and adrenaline of its theme parks and attractions are six unique luxury hotels, the world-class Resorts World Convention Centre, a casino and the Asian flagship of a world-renowned destination spa. RWS offers award-winning dining experiences and exciting cuisines from around the world across its many renowned celebrity chef restaurants, establishing itself as a key player in Singapore’s vibrant and diverse dining scene and a leading gourmet destination in Asia for epicureans. The integrated resort also offers world-class entertainment, from original resident productions to concerts and public shows such as Crane Dance and Lake of Dreams. RWS has been named “Best Integrated Resort” since 2011 for nine consecutive years at the TTG Travel Awards which recognises the best of Asia-Pacific’s travel industry. RWS is wholly owned by Genting Singapore, a company of the Genting Group. For more information, please visit www.rwsentosa.com.

Job Description:
· Help render patient care in accordance to the policies & standards set by the hospital.
· Assist Senior Staff Nurse/Staff Nurse in serving of oral medication, nursing procedures such as dressing and naso-gastric feeding, orientation & clinical guidance for Nursing Aide/Healthcare Assistant.
· Assist in report writing on patients' condition & progress on nursing management of patients.
· Take on any other responsibilities delegated by the Nursing Division in line with the needs of the hospital.
Requirements:
· National ITE Certificate in Nursing
· Enrolled with the Singapore Nursing Board
· Mature, caring and interested in geriatric nursing
· Experience in an acute care or community setting background
· Possesses clinical knowledge and skills
· Excellent interpersonal and communication skills

description:

Assigned in a range of clinical settings - inpatient care of patients undergoing rehabilitative and sub-acute care together with multidisciplinary team of allied health professionals focusing on integrative care of patients with chronic diseases, geriatric syndromes and rehabilitative needs or diverse settings like outpatient clinic, home care as well as community (e.g., providing medical support for nursing home and community team).

title: Staff Nurse (St. Andrew's Community Hospital)
company_info: St. Andrew's Mission Hospital (SAMH) first began as a free dispensary for poor local and migrant women and children in 1913. Today, SAMH operates St. Andrew's Community Hospital, St. Andrew’s Autism Centre, St. Andrew’s Mission Hospital Clinics, St. Andrew’s Nursing Homes at Buangkok, Henderson and Queenstown and St. Andrew’s Senior Care centres at Kampong Glam, Tampines, Henderson and Queenstown. St. John's-St. Margaret’s Nursing Home and Senior Care Centre at Dover Avenue will begin operations in 2021.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:
· Attend to patients' medical needs, such as serving medications, giving injections and dressing wounds.
· Provide a high standard of care through care management, assessment, planning, implementation and evaluation of nursing care to meet the needs of the patients, including educating patients and families.
· Ensure and maintain the standards for professional nursing practice and work co-operatively with the other members of the healthcare team to provide comprehensive, integrated and cost-effective care.
· Orientate and guide the junior nurses to provide optimal care to meet desired patient outcomes experiences.
· Assist Nurse Manager/Senior Staff Nurse in implementing and executing all administrative and clinical nursing services in the ward
· Help render patient care in accordance to the policies & standards set by the hospital.
· Assist in report writing on patients' condition & progress on nursing management of patients.
· Take on any other responsibilities delegated by the Nursing Division in line with the needs of the hospital.

Job Requirements:
· Degree or Diploma in Nursing/Advanced Diploma In Nursing
· Possess a valid Practising Certificate from Singapore Nursing Board
· Display qualities in motivating, leading and supervising junior staff
· Highly motivated with the ability to work in a team
· Prior experience working in the industry will be an advantage

title: Electrical Engineer (M&E|Hospital)
company_info: CTES CONSULTING PTE. LTD. Our Recruitment Consultants are equipped with extensive recruitment and industry expertise in their areas of specialisation. The experience combined with their commitment to establish a deep understanding of our client and their business priorities enable CTES to deliver value far beyond the service provided by traditional search firms. We provide an impeccable match. At CTES, we believe in providing a seamless match between candidate and client. We deem it our responsibility to thoroughly understand our client's needs, and to obtain in-depth knowledge of the job requirements and the culture of the client's organization. This enables us to provide suitable and proficient candidates to our clients. By ensuring a close match between the candidate and position, we are able to foster a win-win situation, for both our clients and our candidates. CTES aims to be an organisation renowned throughout the Asia-Pacific region, integral to both employers and career seekers. We hope to become the preferred HR and career consultants for our clients and candidates respectively.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our client is actively searching for an Electrical Engineer to join their team!
If you are a dynamic individual seeking a new career opportunity, read further!

The responsibilities of this role are:
Lead the team for engineering, planning, construction schedule, load calculation, prepare raceway routing design, drawing/3D model (i.e. HT, LT cables, busduct and control & instrument cables routing on cable ladder, tray and trunking from transformer, LV Switch-Gear, MCC, DB/CU, LCP etc. to equipment), conducting walkthrough presentation as necessary and submission to consultant approval.
Liaising with consultants and vendors for selection of equipment and material for procurement of various equipment and plant lightings, switches and socket outlets based on area classification (e.g. hazarded /non-hazard).
Lead the team for coordinating with other trade teams and sub-contractor to ensure works are carried out according to design, specification and quality plan and safety standard.
Lead the team for testing and commission.
The ideal candidate will need to have the following qualities and experience:
Minimum Diploma/Degree in Electrical Engineering with Experience
Preferably with 3 or more years of experience in hospital or medical facilities or power & utilities environments
Proficient in using AutoCAD software and Microsoft Office
Added advantages for familiar with the smart Switchboard and programming knowledge
Able to perform under tight schedules and deadlines with minimum supervisions
Strong interpersonal communication skills.
An exciting career awaits the right candidate! Click "Quick Apply" to register your interest now.

All applicants' CV will be treated with the strictest confidentiality. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
